No, sorry. ||| It creates a more succulent dish and adds a little theatricality to dinner. ||| If I burden myself with a little helpmate during my adventures, this is not out of sentiment or caprice, it is that he has many fine qualities of his own that he has overlooked in his obsession with me.

jp_contexts: 退屈してるかと 思ったのよ... こんな名もない場所の 主婦なんかが相手じゃ ||| 名も無い所から出てきた若い女性は 成功しようと必死になるものだ ||| ここは貴女の家です 名もない場所じゃない
english_translations: No, just maybe it's a little dull for you... sitting here telling this to some housewife in the middle of nowhere. ||| A girl from nowhere will desperate to make it big, ||| This is your home. This isn't nowhere.

jp_contexts: - 俺は名を成したい ||| だた君の立場は違う 名を成すチャンスだ ||| アンソニー･アマド 名を成す為に容赦ない
english_translations: - I want my 15 seconds of fame. ||| You, on the other hand, have a chance to make a name for yourself. ||| RICHIE: Anthony Amado had a major hard-on to make a name for himself.

jp_contexts: 「コミュニケーション連鎖に あなたの本名を残さない様に」 ||| "レンジャー"の名を残す 小さな証だ。 ||| 歴史に名を残すような偉大な 人物になれば、永遠に保存しますよ
english_translations: "so we don't have a clear record of your true name in our final communication chain. ||| Somebody named Ranger might need a little proof. ||| Of course. Just be a historical document worthy of storing for all eternity.

jp_contexts: 神の名を汚したのよ 鍵を渡すなら ||| FBIの名を汚さなければ、 麻薬を使わなければ 昇進は当たり前だ。 ||| それで名を汚すことに
english_translations: On the name of the lord himself. ||| When you're neither a disgrace to the Bureau nor a drug addict, good things can happen. ||| You decided to ruin it.

jp_contexts: 惜しむらくは ２年前に 名を馳せた探偵にとって 遅すぎたということです ||| オセアニアの海で 勇気と力と青春が 残虐に名を馳せた 蛮族の犠牲になった ||| 今後は　名を馳せることだろう "ダース・ヴェイダー"として
english_translations: 'Sadly, all this comes too late for the detective, 'who became something of a celebrity two years ago.' ||| On the oceans of Australasia, courage, strength and youth are sacrificed, sacrificed to barbarians whose only honour is atrocity. ||| Henceforth you shall be known as... Darth... Vader.

idiom: 名乗り を 上げる
jp_contexts: あなたが言う " 変化 " に期待し、オレは名乗りを上げました。 ||| ニキ･ラウダが再び 表舞台へ戻ってきました 世界チャンピオン争いに 名乗りを上げます ||| 完成したら私が実験台に 名乗りを上げようじゃないか
english_translations: I volunteered because you said things would change. ||| Niki Lauda is a major step closer to retaining the World Championship. ||| I must admit I, I sampled it and ended up drinking it all.

jp_contexts: 命を懸けて人々に伝えてやる ||| 君たちは 我々を守るため... 戦ってくれている 命を懸けて だが君たちをヒーローだと 言う者もいれば... ||| サミーンは 証券取引所で命を懸けた
english_translations: The only way to make people listen is to give our lives. ||| You have fought for us... protected us, risked your lives... but while a great many people see you as heroes... there are some... who would prefer the word "vigilantes." ||| Sameen risked everything at the stock exchange.

idiom: 命 を 投げ出す
jp_contexts: 仕事もなく 生活は厳しい でも息子のためなら 命を投げ出すわ ||| 力が足りないと 分かっても― 犠牲を払っても― 命を投げ出しても... ||| 奴らのために 命を投げ出そうとしてた
english_translations: I don't have a job and life for me is hard, but I would still die for him, you know. ||| Even when it's not perfect, even if it costs you something, even if it costs you everything. ||| You was willin' to get killed for 'em.

jp_contexts: 体調が悪い人に 命を預ける気にはなれない ||| お前なんかに 世界や 人類や 自分の命を預けなきゃなんねぇオレ達への見返りがこれかよ ||| ここで命を預けてくれないか?
english_translations: I'm not putting my life in your hands if you're not 100%. ||| Is this our payback for placing mankind's future and our very survival in your hands? ||| Could you throw me a bone here, man?

idiom: 問題 に なる ない
jp_contexts: 俺の貞節は、問われるかもしれない。 それで問題にならなければいいなと思ってる。 ||| この数キロのかばんは、 数千キロの飛行機と比べると、 問題にならないでしょ？ その上貨物としても手荷物としても 重さは、変わらないはずでしょ？ ||| これ以上問題にならないよう
english_translations: loyalty issues going on, and I do not want to end up rn between my fidelity to you and the reality of having to keep my nose clean. ||| What difference does a few extra pounds make on a three-ton aircraft, whether that's up above or underneath? ||| So you shouldn't have any more... Problems.

jp_contexts: 喧嘩を売る気か ||| 政府に喧嘩を売った 女の発言とは思えないね？ ||| 何で俺に喧嘩を売ってるんだ？ そっちこそ 何で俺に喧嘩を売ってるんだ？
english_translations: We gonna fight, Raymond? ||| Aren't you the same woman who told the government to kiss her ass a few years ago? ||| Why you been acting so messed up towards me?

jp_contexts: 嘘で固めるなら もっと上手くやることだ ||| 一回だけで済むだろうって ...そうなると騙し行為の 嘘で固めた人生の始まりだ ||| 嘘で固めた人生だな
english_translations: You know, for somebody who lies all the time, I'd think you'd be better at it. ||| What I hoped would be a one-time event was just the beginning of a life consumed with lies, intrigue and deception. ||| A life that is a big fat lie.

jp_contexts: 嘘をつくならもっとマシな 嘘をつけ ||| 島を出るのならば すべて嘘をつけ ||| ジル　ましな嘘をつけ
english_translations: But you'll have to spin a better story than that if you expect it to get you off the hook. ||| If you have to go, then you have to lie about everything. ||| Jill, I'm not buying it.

jp_contexts: 私達はシャンプーのボトルを突っ込んだの 嘘を言うな！ ||| 俺が死体を見つけた朝のことで 聞きたいことがあるから来いと 俺に嘘を言ったことか？ それとも ||| 嘘を言うな 腹から脳まで切り裂くぞ そして自分の臓物を食わせる
english_translations: - I fell down on the shampoo ... - You lie! ||| Lying and telling me you needed me to come here to answer questions about the morning I found the corpse, or plotting against my boss? ||| Lie to me again and I'll open you from your belly to your brain and feed you your intestines.

jp_contexts: 因果応報を示さないとな ||| お前の功徳は因果応報で ||| 因果応報を信じなければな
english_translations: Whatever the play, it has to do double-duty. ||| What merits and retribution are you looking to? ||| unless you believe in karma.

idiom: 圧力 を 掛ける
jp_contexts: 即、攻撃は無い 先ずは圧力を掛けるだろ？ ||| 不必要な圧力を 掛ける気じゃないよ 君にね ||| もう少しの圧力を掛けてくれ ちょうどいいくらいの
english_translations: All they have to do is hint. Vaguely insinuate. ||| Just not wanting to put any unnecessary pressure on-- on you. ||| Give me a little more pressure. Just what I need.

jp_contexts: 彼のキャリアも地に落ちました ||| 地に落ちた者. . そいつの名は. ||| もし今夜攻撃すれば 我らの人間性は地に落ちる
english_translations: The nail in the coffin of a career. And Powers kicks his glove. ||| And his name, for ever more, was the Fallen. ||| If we attack tonight Our humanity is lost.

jp_contexts: ラングとハッチの2人の将軍が権力を争い ラングが勝利しハッチは地下に潜った ||| それで、俺たちは地下に潜ったのさ ||| 私の所に来たら 地下に潜って
english_translations: Two generals claim power. Lang wins the war. Hatch hides in the shadows. ||| So, my team went dark. ||| If they get to me, you're going down, too, remember that.

jp_contexts: ちょっと、堅くなってる ||| そうお堅くなるな ||| 堅くなる必要はない。 全体を解決しようと思うな。
english_translations: Maybe they're a little tight. ||| You're just too tense, man. ||| You don't need to come up with the whole solution.

jp_contexts: 壁を作って 抑えつけろ ||| 心に壁を作るな ||| あなたは自分に 壁を作ってる
english_translations: Create a mental block, repress them. ||| Let down the walls. ||| - Yes. You spend a lot of time building walls, Hannibal.

jp_contexts: 今朝は仕事で早く出たので 起こしたくないのもあって 声を掛けていません ||| 日曜か月曜に会ってる 彼と会話中に 君は声を掛けただろ？ ああ ||| 絶対に声を掛けて
english_translations: Uh, I left early this morning for work, so I didn't want to wake her up, so I didn't check on her. ||| You met him last Sunday or Monday, we were talking and a guy came to get me. ||| No, of course call Ivy.

jp_contexts: - 声を落とせ ||| シー 声を落として ||| 声を落とせ 奴等が来ている
english_translations: - Keep your voice down. ||| Shh. Keep your voice down. ||| Keep your voice down. They're coming.

jp_contexts: 多勢に無勢だ ||| 多勢に無勢よ. ||| 多勢に無勢です
english_translations: We're outnumbered five to one. ||| We're outnumbered. ||| They beat us in number.

jp_contexts: たどり着くことは 決してない その夢の世界に... ||| - 形の無い夢の世界 ||| マトリックスとは 夢の世界 人類を支配し 必要なものとして利用する
english_translations: We shall never find that lovely land of Might-Have-Been. ||| - Unconstructed dream space. ||| The Matrix is a computer-generated dream world built to keep us under control in order to change a human being into this.

jp_contexts: - そうだ、 夢を見たよ ||| イカれた、2重の夢を見た ||| 非現実的な夢を見ては それを乗り越えて来た
english_translations: - Well, you... I was dreaming. ||| I just had a crazy double dream. ||| I wished for a lot of unrealistic things. - I got over them too.

jp_contexts: どんな夢を描いてる？ ||| 我々は圧力を受けながら 勢力を結集した 我々が夢を描いていた以上に 成功した ||| 夢を描かなければならなかった時 それを社会の周辺に捨ててしまった
english_translations: What do you dream of? ||| We joined forces under pressure but were successful beyond our wildest dreams ||| When I had to leave them as dreams

jp_contexts: 反抗し イカれてて 夢を追う ||| いつも夢を追う人なら ||| エディの邪魔をしたくないし 夢を追って欲しいからって
english_translations: Rebels, lunatics, dreamers. ||| When your heart is in your dream ||| She was pregnant, said she didn't want Eddie to deal with the responsibility, wanted him to pursue his music.

jp_contexts: だから大口を叩く前に その事を思い出してね ||| 大口を叩いてるけど無害ね ||| それは無理です 聞きましたよ あなたは生化学学会で 大口を叩いて
english_translations: So keep that in mind before you even think about opening your big mouth. ||| The guy's got a big mouth, but he's harmless. ||| I hear you like to get sauced at biochemistry conventions and brag about how you're gonna win the Nobel Prize for the work you're doing here, research that has been entirely funded by my late husbands money.

idiom: 大手 を 振る,大手 を 振る て
jp_contexts: えぇ 大手を振ってね - 銃だ！ ||| これは皆さんへの警告です こんな怪物が 大手を振って街中をかっ歩しています ||| 先ず 犯罪が大手を振って まかり通る最悪の都市になった
english_translations: - Yeah, we will. ||| Let this be a warning to you, ladies and gentlemen, that there are monsters amongst us in the world. ||| First off, this is the worst damn city in the world to commit a crime.

jp_contexts: １度くらいなら大目に見る トイレ休憩が１回だけ ||| だから 大目に見て かばってきた そしてリスボンに 惨めな思いもさせてきた ||| 大目に見ると言ったわ
english_translations: Maybe we can have one stop for a coke and a pee, and that's it. ||| So I tolerate you and I protect you and I let you make Lisbon's life a misery. ||| You said you'd cut them some slack. I know.

jp_contexts: すでにほかの地区で御覧頂いておりますように 「子供の城」プロジェクトは三年前のスタート以来 天井知らずの利益を上げております ||| 資産価値は天井知らず ||| 彼が死ねば　その価値は 天井知らずに上がるわね
english_translations: As you can see, since launching the first Kiddie Kastle project three years ago we've had nothing but unencumbered profit margins. ||| With the rumors of gambling going legal, property values are going through the roof. ||| He dies, the prices go through the roof.

idiom: 太刀 打ち できる ない
jp_contexts: 傭兵では太刀打ちできない ||| For there's no man in town half as manly 誰も太刀打ちできない ||| 警察も太刀打ち出来ない
english_translations: They'll beat any mercenary army. ||| For there's no man in town half as manly ||| Maybe way beyond them, too.

jp_contexts: しかし、愛のために全てを 放棄した頭のいい女性は、 必然的に自分自身を 見つめ奈落の底へ、 男性や、赤ちゃんでは、 単純に埋められない。 ||| 奈落の底まで突き落とされるわ ||| お前に奈落の底へと...
english_translations: But a woman with brains who gives up everything for love inevitably finds herself staring into an existential abyss that men, babies and cardio bars simply cannot fill. ||| You will end up at the bottom of a hole. ||| I remember you tossing me into an abyss.

jp_contexts: ケンカしても始まらない ||| 進歩は始まらないよ 夢の意味を認めらないまま ||| 考えてみてくれ 長椅子に寝ていても何も始まらない
english_translations: Come on. Now we're not gonna get anywhere fighting. ||| You won't make any progress... until you recognize your dreams for what they are. ||| I'm not gonna get over anything by just lying on the couch. It's not a good idea.

idiom: 始末 を 付ける
jp_contexts: さっさと立って 外で始末を 付けようじゃないか ||| 安心しな　刑事さん 俺にエディを殺った奴の 始末を付けさせれば− 手間をかけない ||| 始末を付けるに十分な
english_translations: You're gonna get up, and we're gonna settle this outside. ||| Rest assured, Detective, if I find the person responsible for Eddie's murder, you'll never know. ||| We could pay you to have it cleaned up.

jp_contexts: やつらが姑息な手を使って 隠した事実さ ||| 俺と向き合ったらどうだ 操り人形で 姑息な手段を使わないで ||| 姑息な連中だよ
english_translations: They use static electricity to... to mask the changes. ||| Face me like a real man, not with your hand up another's ass like a bloody puppet. ||| Even for this group, that takes nerve.

idiom: 嫌 と いう ほど
jp_contexts: 証拠は もう嫌というほど ||| もし、生きていないなら、 イザベル・ロシェフは遠慮せずに 嫌というほど見せつけてるさ 信じろ、彼は生きている ||| かなり訓練を受けた 嫌というほど
english_translations: Boss, we've already been through all this. I mean, I got no leads; ||| If he wasn't, Isabel Rochev wouldn't be so shy about rubbing it in our faces. ||| I trained you well.

jp_contexts: 完璧に身柄を奪取 騒ぎも無く 無傷で ||| すべて完璧です ||| 完璧なチャーミング
english_translations: Clean lift. Nothing broken, nothing split. ||| The pede looks perfect. ||| "Is this perfect Child of heaven"

jp_contexts: 宙に浮く？ ||| 逆フラッシュが何かすれば 液体が宙に浮くんだ ||| 宙に浮いてるよ
english_translations: - Can you levitate? ||| Whenever something happens with the Reverse-Flash, liquid floats in the air. ||| She's not touching the floor.

jp_contexts: その努力が実を結び 悪の拠点がまた一つ消滅 ||| 苦労が実を結んだと感じる ||| 核戦争回避の為の努力も実を結んでいません
english_translations: It was a textbook operation, Mr. Chairman. ||| and I say, "that's good, I have learned." ||| All diplomatic efforts to avert Nuclear war have thus far failed.

idiom: 小耳 に 挟む,耳 に 挟む
jp_contexts: 小耳に挟んだだけ ||| 小耳に挟みましたよ あなたの大切な秘密も ||| 小耳に挟んだのさ
english_translations: Oh,I shouldn't have been listening. ||| I've heard the chatter about this private initiative. ||| - I hear stories.

idiom: 尻拭い を する
jp_contexts: 感謝するのね CDCが尻拭いをする ||| あるいは、シモンズの尻拭いを しなきゃ いけないのか・・・ またな？ ||| バブル時代に やりたい放題やった 上の連中の尻拭いをするために 俺達は 銀行員になったわけじゃない こんなところで追い出されてみろ
english_translations: Thank God the CDC arrived to do your job for you. ||| Or am I gonna have to save Simmons' ass... again? ||| We didn't become bankers to clean up after the mess of the folks at the top who did whatever they pleased during the bubble era. all our efforts will remain unrewarded.

idiom: 嵐の 前 の 静け さ
jp_contexts: 嵐の前の静けさは最高だな ||| 嵐の前の静けさを楽しんでる ||| 嵐の前の静けさじゃ
english_translations: I like these calm little moments before the storm. ||| Oh, just, uh, enjoying the calm before the storm. ||| It's the deep breath before the plunge.

jp_contexts: 彼を左遷したら 今より状況が悪くなる ||| 左遷もええとこですね 大左遷ですわ　これ ||| あなたは左遷された身でしょう？
english_translations: The danger is, uh, replacing him with someone worse than the original. ||| This is a demotion, huge demotion ||| Look who's talking. You're the one who got put out to pasture.

idiom: 巻き添え を 食う
jp_contexts: 彼女も巻き添えを食います ||| 巻き添えを食うのは ごめんだ ||| 君たち2人も その巻き添えを食って殺される
english_translations: She's collateral damage. ||| - But I'm not gonna let your bullshit take me down. ||| He also made it very clear that you two would be caught in the crossfire.

jp_contexts: 席を外して下さい ||| 席を外して 悪いけど ||| ロブ、席を外してくれる？
english_translations: Leave me. ||| Reg, step out. It's okay. ||| Rob, could we have the room?

jp_contexts: 幕が上がったな ||| 幕が上がったら すぐ女神を殺す ||| 幕が上がってしまうぞ
english_translations: The curtain rises. ||| Soon as that curtain rises, we are gonna be there to take out this Calliope. ||| The curtain is about to go up.

jp_contexts: 連続殺人犯 ジョー・キャロルの人生は 今朝早く幕を下ろしました ||| 残念だけど　幕を下ろさなきゃならなくなった ・・・・早々とね ||| もう幕を下ろすときだ
english_translations: Serial killer Joe Carroll's life came to an end early this morning. ||| Sorry we had to close early, but you get the general idea. ||| This is what takes us down.

jp_contexts: そりゃ、幸先がいいな ||| 幸先がいい ||| 幸先がいいな
english_translations: Well, so much for our head start. ||| The gods favor you. ||| A good start.

jp_contexts: 店を畳んでたら こうはなってないわ ||| だが それでお前が 店を畳んだだろ ||| 店を畳んでないのが 見えませんか？
english_translations: If you'd just quit the restaurant, none of this would've happened. ||| You made the right choice, though, didn't you, by choosing to close the restaurant? ||| What, you want me to close the shop?

jp_contexts: - 店を閉める時は死ぬ時 - 良い知らせがあります ||| それから店を閉めて 退勤しろ ||| 店を閉めて
english_translations: - I'll close the shop only when I croak. ||| Then close up the shop. Clock out. ||| Close the store.

idiom: 引き合い に 出す
jp_contexts: I wasn't referring to the wheelchair 私 車椅子を 引き合いに 出すつもりは なかった ||| あなたはうんざりしてる 彼はローレルを引き合いに出した ||| それに対して　君の本では 虐待をアニスが自分に打ち明けたと言う 隣人を匿名で　引き合いに出した
english_translations: I wasn't referring to the wheelchair. ||| Ok, you're pissed he invoked the almighty Laurel. ||| Your book, on the other hand, you quoted an anonymous source, a neighbor who claimed that Ennis had confided in him about the abuses.

idiom: 引き金 に なる
jp_contexts: トレーラーが引き金になって 全て思い出す可能性があるが ||| ３年前の手術で頭部を傷つけて 早期発症の引き金になっていたかも ||| 引き金になる
english_translations: If going to the trailer helps bring back her memories, then there's a chance that she's gonna remember everything. ||| The head trauma that put him in surgery three years ago could've triggered an early onset. ||| It all triggers it.

jp_contexts: 〈大学病院の医局は弱体化し→ 命のやりとりをする医療も→ ついに 弱肉強食の時代に突入した〉 ||| しかし　それは 弱肉強食によって支配されます ||| 自然界は弱肉強食 適者生存よ
english_translations: University hospitals' medical offices were losing power, and even medicine, which deals with life and death, plunged into an era where the law of jungle prevailed. ||| But this one is governed by the law of the jungle. ||| Nature adds and subtracts. Survival of the fittest.

jp_contexts: 弱音を吐いている ||| 彼はいつも弱音を吐くの？ ||| 君がたむろしているサークルは 多くの臆病者が弱音を吐いている
english_translations: - Whi... Whinier than I thought. - Hmm. ||| Does he always whine this much? ||| Maybe you've just been hanging out with too many timid and whiny people.

idiom: 影 も 形 も ない
jp_contexts: ホタルの影も形もない ||| 影も形もなく隠せるわよ ||| 大統領は影も形もない
english_translations: No sign of Firefly. ||| And you will never find this again until I want you to find it. ||| No sign of the President yet.

jp_contexts: それがお前に 影を落としてる ||| そうだなぁ 魔獣の呪文が 何にでも 影を落としているからなぁ ||| ...景気回復の見通しに 影を落としています

jp_contexts: チャドが生活体験者の名簿を 持って来なければ 全て水の泡 ||| 私が捕まれば全てが水の泡 ||| 今を逃せば水の泡
english_translations: If Chad doesn't get back with that list of live-aboards, it was all for nothing. ||| If they arrest me, this mission is blown. ||| It's a needle in a haystack after this.

jp_contexts: 心をなくしてた　それが彼女 スポーツして汗を流すこともなく ただひたすら研究してた ||| そうです　食事はビーガン 走って汗を流します ||| 共に血と汗を流し 弾の雨をくぐって来た
english_translations: You're losing your mind, and there she is, working just as hard, not even breaking a sweat. ||| Yeah, I actually did. I'm a vegan. And I started working out, and running, and working out, and running... ||| We've shared blood, sweat and precious metal together.

jp_contexts: キャット・グラントは、Catcoの ハックについて沈黙を 破ろうとしています。 ||| その一帯に囮貨物船が到着次第 無線で沈黙を破ります ||| 夫が沈黙を破ります 妻の失踪に― 彼の不倫や噂の事を
english_translations: It seems Cat Grant's silence regarding the Catco hack is about to be broken. ||| Soon as the decoy freighters arrive in the system, they'll break wireless silence. ||| A husband breaks his silence, not just on his wife's disappearance... but on his infidelity, and all those shocking rumors.

jp_contexts: よう なんだ 一体どこで油を売っていた? ||| 冬が来るまでずっと ここで油を売ってるつもりか？ ||| 油を売るために 電話した訳じゃない
english_translations: Hey, man, where'd you run off to? ||| Do you plan on sitting here scratching your balls till winter? ||| I don't make the call about which, if any, of these charges hold water.

jp_contexts: 彼の注意を引いて下さい ||| 確かに誕生日会はしなかった 周りの注意を引くからな 警察の目も光ってた 目立たない方がいい ||| 念じて物を動かしたり 少しでも父の注意を 引こうとして
english_translations: Distract him. ||| Well, you didn't have birthday parties, because that would draw attention to us and with the police looking for us, that's not a good thing. ||| Or that I was moving stuff around with my mind, hoping it might get him to pay a little more attention.

idiom: 注目 に 値する
jp_contexts: 本当にそれは注目に値します 本当に驚異的です CIAにとっては大成功ですね 貴方が作戦統制を管理して以来 ||| 注目に値する ||| 科学者で鑑定家としてそう思った こりゃ何だ？ 注目に値する
english_translations: I must say, it is remarkable, really astounding, the success that the CIA has had since you have taken operational control, and so the President has asked me to ask you to ask him, to invite you both ||| Remarkable. ||| And as a scientist and a connoisseur, I have I have no idea the contents of this remarkable potion.

idiom: 注目 を 浴びる
jp_contexts: 頭は低く, つねに目を見張れ, 注目を浴びたい衝動に打ち克て. ||| 彼らは隊で侵入 メディアと国家からの注目を浴び 人質の命を盾に ||| やっとボスの 注目を浴びるチャンスが 来たかと思った
english_translations: Keep your head down, keep your eyes up, resist the urge to be seen as important or special. ||| they enter with force, drew the attention of the media and law enforcement using human hostages as collateral for their demands. ||| I saw a chance to step up for you, get noticed.

jp_contexts: そう娘を探してる時は いつもこんなよ 娘が消息を絶ってから... ||| レバノン内戦にキリスト教徒側で参戦して その後消息を絶ったが ||| 教授はラングーンに到着後 消息を絶っています 妻であるアウン・サン・スー・チー氏 を訪ねる目的だった模様
english_translations: Yes, he stays out this late when he's looking for my daughter, since my daughter has been gone -- yes! ||| Fought with the Christian Phalangists in the Civil War, then disappeared. ||| It has not been seen since his arrival in Rangoon where he came to visit his wife.

jp_contexts: どんな時も 涼しい顔してたよね？ ||| 彼女は涼しい顔で人生を乗り切ってきた ||| 竜巻の中に歩いて入り... 涼しい顔で出て来る男
english_translations: How'd you always make it look so easy? ||| She handled life like it was easy. ||| We need someone who can walk into a tornado, and come out the other side like it was a damn gentle breeze.

idiom: 濡れる 衣 を 着せる
jp_contexts: Vが濡れ衣を着せたのは二度目 ||| まぁ... 教会の金庫を空にする目的で 会計係に濡れ衣を着せ 自分が着服したと考えている ||| 社長に殺人犯の濡れ衣を着せれば 事業計画を妨害できると言うのは わかるけど えらく回りくどいやり方ね
english_translations: - It's the second time V's framed you... for something you didn't do. - Anything you wanna tell us? ||| Well, we think he framed the church accountant for clearing out the church's coffers and took the money for himself. ||| I get that framing the head of a company for murder could throw a hitch in his business plan, but it's a hell of a long way to go.

idiom: 濡れる 衣 を 着せる られる,濡れる 衣 を 着せる
jp_contexts: 濡れ衣を着せられた じゃリストを盗んだ人物は　まだ逃走中か ||| あなたを破滅させたがってる人物に 濡れ衣を着せられたように見せかけた ||| 濡れ衣を着せられるのはごめんだ
english_translations: So the person who stole the list is still at large. ||| You were being framed by someone who wanted to destroy you. ||| I ain't going down on some trumped-up murder charge.

idiom: 火中 の 栗 を 拾う
jp_contexts: 火中の栗を拾う性分 ||| 火中の栗を拾うなら そうなるだろう 奴らは我々をも 普通の人間扱いするだろうか？ ||| 彼らは海洋で仕事を 火中の栗を拾っている それを了解なしに引き上げようと
english_translations: You never could keep yourself out of trouble, either. ||| Not if we risk our lives doing so. ||| They're out there in the freakin' ocean risking their lives for us, and you raise their taxes without asking me?

jp_contexts: 古いゲームの所為にしてると マスコミに知れたら ||| 俺がした事は全て君の為に さようなら ||| これまでお前の為に色々な事を お前を守る為にして来た お母さんが亡くなってから
english_translations: If this gets out to the press that we are pinning this on some old video game...! ||| Everything I ever did was for you. All board. All board. ||| Sweetheart, everything that I've ever done was only to protect you after your mother had died.

jp_contexts: 自分にもっと度量があったら アナタに応えられた アナタの為になる事を ||| 沈黙が君の為に なるとは思えない ||| お前がしっかりしなきゃ ヤツの為にならないぞ
english_translations: I just keep wishing that I'd been bigger somehow, able to give you... what you needed to be okay again after you got back, but I couldn't. ||| I don't believe the life of the Silent Sisters is for you. ||| You oughtta lock him up for his own good.

jp_contexts: その烏合の衆の中に 交渉権を持つ者は？ ||| 烏合の衆のクソ週末兵士に 穴に埋められた ||| 烏合の衆のままでは いさかいが絶えぬだけで
english_translations: Is there any in this rout with authority to treat with me? ||| Buried in a hole by a bunch of weekend warriors! ||| If we work separately, we'll just end up fighting.

idiom: 烙印 を 押す れる
jp_contexts: 特に　自分の父親を殺した子と 烙印を押されるのはね ||| 悪党は全て テロリストの烙印を押され ||| 人生の烙印を押されたんだ
english_translations: Especially when you're branded the kid who killed your dad. ||| This new law, where if you're a bad enough, bad guy they stamp "Terrorist" on your jacket. ||| I was branded for life.

jp_contexts: 無辜の民か それが次のターゲットだ ||| むやみに無辜の民を殺さないなら ||| "アラーは無辜の民を助けてくださる"
english_translations: I-it could be an innocent of some kind, but I think that could be his next kill. ||| As long as you don't kill the innocent ||| "Allah helps the innocent."

idiom: 焦点 を 合わせる
jp_contexts: 考えておるわい 焦点を合わせろ ||| 焦点を合わせるのか。 私は、彼らの正体と、 組織の仕組みを知る価値があると考えました。 ||| 焦点を合わせて 押すんだ
english_translations: I said I would think about it. Now focus. ||| We decided it is worth knowing who these people are and how their organizations operate, because on the other side of the rage and the sadness are clarity and strength, the power we have to focus our efforts effectively, ||| You just take it, point it, and shoot it.

jp_contexts: 熱が冷めるように ||| 結婚すると熱が冷めるって おまえ　言ってたけど 俺たち夫婦は　反対だな ||| 彼のことは　完全に熱が冷めたの
english_translations: Like the passing of a fever. ||| You'd think that marriage would just cool things off, but for us, it's just the opposite. ||| That guy is completely out of my system.

jp_contexts: さて最近　この中の誰かが 少し熱くなってます ||| でもあなたと踊ってみて... なんか熱くなって仕方が無くて... だから... ||| 明日は熱くなってる必要がある
english_translations: Now, one of you has been coming in a little hot lately. ||| But dancing with you got me all hot and bothered, so, you know... ||| I know, it's working. I need to be angry tomorrow.

jp_contexts: - 車で片を付けるか ||| 片を付ける ここに居ろ ||| 俺は片を付けようと言ったんだ
english_translations: I'm gonna keep it about the cars ||| I got business to finish. You stay here. ||| I told you we're finishing this.

jp_contexts: あの建物が分かるか？ ||| - 探してる物が分かったら教えるよ ||| 君の所有物を調べれば 君が持ち出した物が分かるかな？
english_translations: You recognize building, yes? ||| It'd help if I knew what the hell I was looking for. ||| Are they gonna be able to go into your stuff and figure out what you took?

jp_contexts: 君がはっきり物を言うから 推薦したのだ ||| お気に召さない? じゃこれだ デカさが物を言う ||| キャロル、相手を 見て物を言えよ
english_translations: I recommended you to the President because you're not afraid to speak up. ||| Let me tell you something, Size does matter. ||| Carol, you got to start listening to yourself when you talk.

idiom: 狙い を つける
jp_contexts: - イラク人を誘い込んで狙いをつけるか... ||| 俺の言う事を 信じるしかない... 狙いをつけてたのは 女じゃない ||| しかし　わしの心は未だ一度も起こった事が 無いものに狙いをつけている
english_translations: - Either we call the Iraqis and level with them... ||| I mean, I get that you'll just have to take my word for this, but... she wasn't even the one I was aiming for. ||| But my thoughts dwell on what has never been

idiom: 狙い を 定める
jp_contexts: 狙いを定めて ||| シェリーが、彼にがっちり狙いを 定めているって噂よ ||| フリーランサーに狙いを定めてる
english_translations: Set your sight. ||| Because rumor has it Sherry's already staking her claim on him. ||| Got freelancer in my sights.

idiom: 理解 に 苦しむ
jp_contexts: なぜこんなことに夢中になるのか 理解に苦しむわ ||| だから理解に苦しむ なぜ妻に不死身だと言った？ 分別ある人間なら 不死身など信じてない ||| 事故以来のお前って ほんとに理解に苦しむ
english_translations: What got into you? Why did you do it? ||| Which makes it all the more difficult to understand why you would tell your wife that you are immortal, why you would believe, in that moment, something that any sane man would know is impossible. ||| That night of the crash, you started getting all weird. What? What are you talking about?

jp_contexts: ハロー 瓜二つ ||| お父上に瓜二つだ ||| 君は瓜二つだな
english_translations: Hello, doppelganger. ||| You look like your father. ||| You're like a clone.

jp_contexts: 貧乏 甘く見るんじゃないわよ （繭子）え？ ||| 老人だと思って 甘く見るな 究極に極めた力がある ||| 自然の力を甘く見て 思いあがるとこわいぞ
english_translations: Don't underestimate the poor. ||| That old man finally has the power that he's always yearned for. ||| The lack of humility before nature that's being displayed here staggers me.

idiom: 甘い 汁 を 吸う
jp_contexts: 人生はそんなに甘くない 甘い汁を吸う奴もいるんだ ||| 甘い汁を吸う会社だ ||| 大統領はＴＶに出て話をし カネ持ちは甘い汁を吸う
english_translations: Life is full of disappointments for some people. ||| How about that big, fat Soylent Corporation? ||| Hell, even the President gets on TV and tells corporations and the rich to suck eggs.

jp_contexts: フェンスの生ける屍達が... ここを守ってるが ||| むしろ抗生物質を貰う代わりに 歩き回ってる生ける屍みたいね ||| 生ける屍ね
english_translations: You see, I have a lot of free labor here at the fence... living dead pricks that help keep the riffraff out. ||| He'd rather walk around like the living dead instead of just get antibiotics. ||| We are the dead.

jp_contexts: 用を足す機会が 与えられねばならない" もうそのぐらいの 時間は経つだろう ||| だれも家の中で用を足さない ||| ワインを飲み過ぎれば 用を足したくもなる
english_translations: And I do believe we're creeping up on that time. ||| - Vikings. Well, none of them are house-trained. ||| I drank too much wine, I must take a piss.

jp_contexts: 時にはもやしっ子が強大な男になることもある ||| その間にアメリカで最も 権力を持つ男になった ||| 男になる為に？
english_translations: And sickly little boys sometimes become powerful men. ||| Along the way, he happened to become the most powerful man in the state. ||| To become a man?

jp_contexts: しかし 異を唱える声も ||| 彼はロバート王の弟と共謀し ジョフリー王子の王位継承に 異を唱えたらしい ||| リコンの生きている限り 総督の座に異を唱えられる 生かしておくわけがない
english_translations: Though the day is not without controversy. ||| They say he conspired with Robert's brothers to deny the throne to Prince Joffrey. ||| As long as he lives, Ramsay's claim to Winterfell will be contested, which means he won't live long.

idiom: 痛い 目 に 遭う
jp_contexts: 痛い目に遭うか？ ||| 他社に移って 痛い目に遭わせる ||| え　いや 君は痛い目に遭う事になる
english_translations: I'm going to kick your ass. ||| Yeah, that man lives in fear. I'll go across town. Hell, I could go anywhere. ||| Eh, no, you're gonna get hurt.

jp_contexts: 私達の事に的を絞ると とやかく言われる ||| - 標的を絞ってる ||| だから 標的を絞ると
english_translations: And focusing on us and not on the affair. ||| I think it's targeting people. ||| So you focus on the highest value target.

idiom: 目 が ある,みる 目 が ある
jp_contexts: 君は、見る目があるよ ||| なかなか見る目がある ||| 人を見る目があるな
english_translations: Trust you've had a chance to take a look around, huh? ||| A man of taste. ||| You're a good judge of character.

jp_contexts: あぁ 目が回ってるさ ||| 目が回るか？ ||| なんか... すごく... 目が回る
english_translations: - Yeah, we do. We sure do. ||| Quickly, quickly, quickly. Do you feel dizzy? ||| I... feel... awfully... dizzy!

jp_contexts: ５通目が届いた後　返事を書き始めたよ ||| 私たちを 守るためだって... 目が届くからって ||| よりいっそう細部にまで目が届き より本質に迫れる
english_translations: I began to reply after the fifth one. ||| She said it was to protect us, so she could patrol things. ||| I prefer to work on the originals.

jp_contexts: 鎮静剤を打つ 家で目が覚めるだろう ||| 原因爆弾はそれらの束を目が覚めました。 ||| それは脅し方次第じゃなくって 殺せば目が覚めるだけ
english_translations: I'm gonna give you a sedative. You'll wake up back at home. ||| Cause bombs woke up a bunch of them. ||| That depends on what you're threatening. Killing him will just wake him up.

idiom: 目 が 離せる ない
jp_contexts: - ファスコ刑事から目が離せない ||| もう目が離せない 並外れた動き ||| お前から目が離せないからな
english_translations: Keep an eye on Detective Fusco. ||| I can't take my eyes up off it moving so phenomenally ||| I'm keeping an eye on you, you slippery little mutt.

jp_contexts: 目が高いぜ　世界最強の 助っ人を選ぶとは ||| お目が高くていらっしゃいます ||| お 目 が高いですな
english_translations: You were wise to seek help from the world's most deadly weapon. ||| You have a keen eye. ||| Boy, you sure know how to pick 'em.

idiom: 目 と 鼻 の 先
jp_contexts: 目と鼻の先で暴動になったら ||| そんなところの目と鼻の先で働いているんだ ||| 組織は黒い蓮と呼ばれ ロンドンでも活動してる 君の目と鼻の先でな
english_translations: What if we set your backyard on fire? ||| I can't believe you work right across the street from there. ||| A gang called the Black Lotus, operating here in London right under your nose.

jp_contexts: 怒りは人を盲目にする... 関わらないのが最良だが ||| 想像できるだろ 家柄も何もない子供が 伝説の人物たちを目にするんだ ||| その後２週間の間、我々は 彼を目にすることはなかった
english_translations: When fighting angry, blind men... best we just stay out of the way. ||| You can imagine what it was like for me, a boy from nowhere, with nothing to his name, watching these legendary men, tilting at the lists. ||| And then we didn't see him for two weeks.

jp_contexts: いや、ただ中で目に付いて、思ったんだ ほら、持っておくべきだって ||| ロビー・ボーイは全く目に付かず かつ何時でも見つけられなければならない ||| どうしても目に付く 医者にも行かないのか 私が勧めた
english_translations: No, I just saw it inside and thought I, you know, should bring it along with me. ||| A Lobby Boy's completely invisible, yet always in sight. ||| But I can't help noticing that you are nowhere near the doctor that I recommended.

jp_contexts: 勤務中この二人が目に入っても、 ||| 見せろ どうせ目に入る ||| 「一番近くの店に行き．．． ．．．目に入った最初のウォンカ・バーを買うんじゃ」
english_translations: From time to time, you're gonna see these two. ||| Show him. He'll find out soon enough. ||| Run down to the nearest store and buy the first Wonka candy bar you see.

jp_contexts: その目に映るもの全て ||| 君の目に映っているのは 本当の僕じゃない ||| 私自身の怖れも 彼女の目に映っていた
english_translations: All the things I see in your eyes. ||| What you're looking at-- that's not who I am inside. ||| And I could read my own terror in her eyes.

jp_contexts: 寝入る姿が目に浮かぶ ||| 目に浮かぶよ 巨大なネオンに君の名 ||| まざまざと目に浮かぶね
english_translations: With one of his lucky strikes in his hand, ||| - Straight to the top. Why, I can see your name in lights, lights six feet high. ||| That's a vivid image.

idiom: 目 に 焼き付く
jp_contexts: 見てしまったら 目に焼き付いて離れない ||| この犯人も目に焼き付かれて いる様ですね ||| 目に焼き付いてます
english_translations: Once you see it, you can't unsee it. ||| It seems this Ouroboros killer was also obsessed with eyes. ||| It's so clear in my mind.

idiom: 目 に 物見 せる
jp_contexts: 目に物見せるわ ||| 目に物見せてやる！ ||| その通りだ 我々は海兵隊だ 我々の手で やつらに目に物見せてやろう
english_translations: Show me something. ||| I'll show you what I've got! This! ||| Marines, we are going to make our point, let them know who they're dealing with.

idiom: 目 に 見える て
jp_contexts: 何か これっていう目標がさ 目に見えてあって 入ってきたわけじゃないから ||| ひざに座らされた子供達が 身もだえするのは目に見えてる ||| 君が失敗するのは 目に見えてる
english_translations: I didn't gain any insight on what I want to work towards. ||| Kids are squirming in his lap all day. It's bound to happen sooner or later. ||| but I'm afraid you're just gonna have to suffer its failure.

jp_contexts: 死体を目に触れやすい屋外に捨てるのは ギャングの仕業らしい気もします ||| 死体写真を 持ってても デクスタの机でやれば ハリソンの 目に触れない ||| 仰々しい演出だ 目に触れるよう 人や物を引用している
english_translations: Dumping the body out in the open like that feels like a gang hit. ||| And maybe you could keep the photos on Dexter's desk, so Harrison won't see them. ||| It's a theatrical term referring to a picturesque grouping of people or objects.

jp_contexts: 密売人や臓器カルテルにとって 私は目の敵です ||| 魔法省はなぜ僕を目の敵に？ ||| おれを目の敵だ
english_translations: Traffickers, cartels. ||| I don't understand. What has the Ministry of Magic got against me? ||| He was just tryin' to bait me.

idiom: 目 の 敵,目 の 敵 に する
jp_contexts: 何で哀れなスメアゴルを 目の敵にする？ ||| 山口の一件で花岡先生を 目の敵にしてるんですよ （蒲生） 裁判所の呼び出しに　応じない場合 ||| 何ヶ月も彼を目の敵にしてきたと言っている
english_translations: Why does he hates poor Sméagol? ||| Kuryu has been targeting him ever since Yamaguchi! ||| Monroe and Clennon had it in for him for months.

jp_contexts: マーシーに関わると 皆 目を付けられる ||| 祈りなさい 目を付けられたぞ　アーサー ||| 他の魚も目を付けてたしね
english_translations: Because anybody associated with Marshy is a marked man. ||| Pray on it. Hello. They're on to you, Arthur. ||| Because a lot of other clownfish had their eyes on this place.

jp_contexts: ♪人を傷つける事に目を伏せるけど ||| もし、マホーンがそこにいったら、 これ以上目を伏せることができない ||| 両親の話をする度に 目を伏せる
english_translations: "Tolerance to do harm to others" ||| What if he's in there? I can't keep avoiding him. ||| Every time I mention my parents, your eyes go down.

jp_contexts: 目を凝らすと 今までの人生が見える ||| 貴方は目を凝らして 耳を澄まして 王子との契約期間を過ごすだけ ||| 遠くに目を凝らしても かすんで消えていく
english_translations: If you look hard enough, you can see your whole life from up here. ||| Lynne, all you have to do now is keep your eyes and ears open for the remainder of your contract with the prince. ||| ♪ And when you look too far away ♪ It all but disappears

jp_contexts: カーターに電話した時に お前は一線を超えた デビッドソンの殺人で 私に目を向けさせようとした ||| ゲームに目を向けながら. . 老人の複雑な心境で ||| まぁ 今は君達２人に 疑いの目を向けている
english_translations: You crossed a line when you made that call to Carter, pointing her towards me in the Davidson murder. ||| Making the tour of the prison before he left and looking on at a game of skittles with the mixed feelings of an old inhabitant who had his private reasons for believing that it might be his destiny to come back again." ||| Well, he did find that book, and he is paying attention to her and to you.

english_translations: I pulled up the department's security camera footage, and a van from Metamorpho Chemical caught my eye. ||| The murder of a cop draws a lot of heat, so dirtying Cooper up is one way to deflect it. ||| So just like this spider, I built my web, hoping to catch the viewer's eye.

jp_contexts: 兄弟の罪に目を瞑った ||| 俺は職務を果たすぞ 目を瞑って　奴がシアトルで捕まるのを 期待するのが最善とは思えん ||| どうしたら目を瞑っていれますか、アンドレ？
english_translations: She turned a blind eye to her brother's sins. ||| I'll do my job myself, instead of praying they catch him in Seattle! ||| How can you be so blind, André?

jp_contexts: うしろめたさから逃れるために そのことから目を背け ||| 目を背けるな ||| 目を背けていたんだ
english_translations: And every time I walked away from something I wanted to forget ||| Don't turn away. ||| Your eyes were open, but you didn't want to see.

jp_contexts: 目を覆うんだ　ナンシー 見てほしくない ||| 目を覆って ♪ welcome to the machine ♪ ♪ where have you been ♪ ||| 目を覆っても 見えるって分かる?
english_translations: Cover your eyes, Nancy. I don't want you watching this. ||| Cover your eyes. _ ? ||| You do know I can see through this?

jp_contexts: 自伝を書かせてるが これは 目を見張るほどの 出来だ ||| 目を見張った！ ||| 目を見張る忍耐力だ
english_translations: It's a simple autobiography and then I get this amazing piece. ||| It is spectacular! ||| You show remarkable grit for a teacher.

jp_contexts: booを開く場合、クソ彼と一緒に座って目を覚ます。 ||| グレゴリーが目を覚ました 話がしたいって ||| 目を覚ますまで 壁を揺すってやる
english_translations: Boo wakes up, you fucking sit up with him. ||| Gregory's up. ||| And I will shake your walls until you wake.

jp_contexts: - これに目を通したら、 ||| 目を通して　たのむよ ||| 「我々は、報告書に全て目を通し、 頭に叩き込んだ」
english_translations: - Look through that, ||| Come on, you'll see. Please. ||| We've done a briefing book, so read up.

jp_contexts: - 目を逸らすな ||| 目を逸らさなかった。 ||| だが今は、誰か死ぬのに目を逸らすか、 解決するか選ぶんだ。
english_translations: - Don't look away. ||| I didn't look away. ||| But you can look away now when someone else dies, or you can help solve this.

jp_contexts: 目を開かせるのです 足ではなく・・ ||| - 我々の会話は、ウィル、 君が本当は何者かという真実に、 君の目を開かせるということだけだ。 ||| アラーは望む... 最後には目を開いて 敵の顔を直視しろと

idiom: 目先 を 変える

jp_contexts: なるほど ったく相変わらず頑固だな ||| 相変わらず兄上は 権力の掌握が大事なのね 兄弟の救出よりも ||| でも彼は相変わらず 時計のネジを巻き続けている

english_translations: That is, by consulting with you, I enlist your help but as much as I can, I believe I must do it myself. ||| Hey, you said you wanted to help me with my dress. ||| Why you slipped me your number in case I ever need to ask anything?

jp_contexts: 真に受けていない ||| あの女の言うことなど 真に受けるな ||| 奴らの言うことを 真に受けちゃだめだ... 地獄みてぇに 狂わされるからな

jp_contexts: それは真っ赤な嘘だった ||| 入局して 真っ赤な嘘だと分かったよ ||| それは真っ赤な嘘だ
english_translations: It was a big lie. ||| I wish someone had told me it is a total lie. ||| That is an outright lie.

jp_contexts: 時間の不変性を冒せば 矛盾が生じるでしょ？ ||| ですがキャリー マティソンの 補記と矛盾 ||| 難しいけど いま話し合って 矛盾点の無いように

jp_contexts: お前は矢面に立ってる... しかし　そうすべきではない ||| 私はお前の馬鹿さの矢面に立つ ||| お前が 矢面に立ってくれた

english_translations: What they don't know won't hurt 'em. ||| Well, sometimes what we don't know doesn't hurt us, right? ||| Ignorance is bliss.

english_translations: You're kind of making me look bad. ||| I don't know, maybe this is my fault. Maybe I'm missing something here. ||| You gotta be 21. They'll lose their license.

jp_contexts: なぜ筋を通さなかった？ ||| 俺たちは筋を通す ||| そこで 私が筋を通し 和解を申し出れば 伯父上も受け入れて 下さることでしょう

idiom: 縁起 だ も ない

english_translations: Don't talk like that! ||| Nonsense! I don't want to live that long. ||| Nonsense! I don't want to live that long.

english_translations: I'll die. I should. But my sister never did anything to you. ||| - Innocent? ||| He is innocent.

jp_contexts: ええ テロリストが 秘密の通路を作って― こっちに罪を着せようとしたのよ 引っ越しくらいしないとね ||| 私に罪を着せないで ||| 彼女を殺した後　自分の技能を使って カール・レズニックに罪を着せようとしたのか？
english_translations: Yeah, well, when a terrorist builds a secret passageway into your apartment and frames you for mass murder, burning a little sage doesn't really cut it. ||| Don't yöu blame this on me. ||| And after you killed her, that's when you decided to use your skills to frame Carl Resnick?

english_translations: Now, my ears aren't what they used to be, but I swear I could have heard you say something about the Carson place. ||| My dad's kind of shy and it'd be nice to have people around with something in common, besides hearing loss. ||| Yes! Demons. Are you deaf?

jp_contexts: ケヴィン いろんな話を耳にし― 俺に関するデタラメを 山ほど読むだろう ||| さて　此奴の事を何か 耳にしたら ||| 彼らが最初 耳にしたのは 北方から近づく嵐の音だった

jp_contexts: 我が君 あなた様のご消息が ちらとでも耳に入っていれば― ||| ある話が耳に入り始めた スターリング市の自警団 ||| それ自分で言うから いい話が 耳に入って来なくなるのよ
english_translations: My Lord, had I detected any sign, a whisper of your whereabouts... ||| I started hearing tales of the Starling City vigilante. ||| When you say it like that, I become deaf to any good parts of your story.

jp_contexts: 私には何のことだか クレア・ウィリアムズが無事だったことを お耳に入れておいた方が ||| 一つお耳に入れておきたい事が ||| 記者の耳に入れたくない事でも？
english_translations: Well, I don't yet know you well enough to ask this but you haven't seemed yourself lately. ||| Sir, there's something you should know. ||| Do you have something to hide from a reporter?

jp_contexts: ストイック 今　小耳に挟んだ 一部の連中が "策は　あるのか?"と ||| でも　彼が誘因だと小耳に挟んだ あなたが最高だと話してる ||| 天使の会話を耳に挟んだ

jp_contexts: 耳を傾けろ、よく聞け ||| サム･ワトソン ヘイモン･ボクシング サム･ワトソン ヘイモン･ボクシング ヘイモンの話に耳を傾け 彼と相談しながら ||| あなたの言うことに 耳を傾けてよかった

english_translations: Hard to believe that Nation States still think they have any influence, even in cooperation. ||| You're just like a yakuza. I can't believe what I'm hearing. ||| I gave them your reason for calling off the air strike, but I must warn you, they were skeptical as well.

jp_contexts: - 耳を貸さないのです ||| これは耳を貸さなくていい ||| 俺に耳を貸したことか？
english_translations: - doesn't always listen. ||| Now, that is you being stubborn. ||| Was it straying from Gellar and listening to me?

idiom: 聞き捨て なる ない
jp_contexts: 聞き捨てならないことを ||| - 聞き捨てならないですな！ ||| 聞き捨てならないね

idiom: 聞く 耳 を 立てる,耳 を 立てる
jp_contexts: 小鳥が聞き耳を立てている では　こちらが笛を吹く！ ||| 散歩ですよ　若い女性に 聞き耳を立てながらね ||| 私の合図を待て 聞き耳を立てて

english_translations: Careful. ||| - I will, definitely. ||| I gotta work on that.

english_translations: I mean, look, I'm not defending the man or nothing like that, it's just, those codes, they... ||| You have to draw a line, you have to back it up. ||| Uh, I'd like you to have my back and stop being so goddamn disappointing like everybody else.

jp_contexts: ‐無茶よ ‐肩を貸すよ ||| 肩を貸すよ。 泣いても舐めてもいい。 ||| いつも そばにいて― 優しい言葉と温かい食事 泣く時は肩を貸してくれました
english_translations: - What? Babe, no! - Come on, I'll help you. ||| You know, if you need a shoulder to cry on or just to nibble on... ||| She was always there with a kind word and a hot meal and a shoulder to cry on.

jp_contexts: それから　こんなふうに 柵を背にして撃ったのか？ ||| 抜け出せない 再びロープを背にした ||| 俺たちはストリートに並んでいる 軍隊を背にして立っている 俺たちの友人だった奴らだ
english_translations: Got up against the railing like this? ||| It doesn't seem to help, because Atom is backed up against the ropes again. ||| We stood side by side against the dark forces on our streets, especially the ones who used to be our friends.

jp_contexts: 初心に戻り 前を向くのか 背を向けるのか ハッキリしろよ ||| エーブルは　ユダヤ人 つまり　彼女は結婚する時に 自分の一族に背を向けた ||| そして僕は逃げ出した 昨日までのすべてに背を向けて まるで転げ落ちるみたいに
english_translations: Here is your chance to kick open that closet door... and do some of that world changing. ||| Abel there is Jewish, which means she turned her back on her entire clan to get married. ||| And then I ran away, turning my back on my entire past, as though tumbling down

idiom: 背中 を 向ける
jp_contexts: この惑星に背中を向けて... 彼方に ...去って行くしかない ||| 私に背中を向けるな！ ||| 誰にも背中を向けるな
english_translations: Only that I've got my back against the planet... and I'm on my way away. ||| Don't you dare turn your back on me! ||| Don't turn your back on anybody.

idiom: 胸 が 張り裂ける
jp_contexts: 胸が張り裂ける ||| 胸が張り裂けそう ||| ［容疑が晴れて　ほっとしましたが］ ［ネル・ソランジュを失くして 胸が張り裂けるような思いです］
english_translations: It's heartbreaking. ||| Heartbreaking. ||| As, uh, relieved as I am that the charges were dropped, my heart breaks for Nell Solange.

jp_contexts: でも 胸が痛まないのか? ||| 驚くほど胸が痛まない ||| 打ち明けるまで 胸が痛んだ
english_translations: But does it hurt you? ||| I feel surprisingly Okay about it. ||| My stomach's been in knots just thinking about telling you.

jp_contexts: 胸に秘めた夢が－ 最も切実なー ||| そうであっても 胸に秘めてるんだ ||| 自分の胸に秘めて でも 死ぬほど苦しくなった
english_translations: You must know that your innermost wishes will be made real here. ||| If they are, they're keeping it to themselves. ||| I just... swallowed it, all of it, until it filled me up, and I was drowning in it.

jp_contexts: ダービーに勝って 胸を張って帰ろう ||| 君が死を前に胸を張ろうと 泣き叫ぼうとー ||| 胸を張って家に帰れる
english_translations: Can't wait till you win this Derby, so we can go home. ||| Whether you're gonna walk like a man or cry like a pussy on your way to the death house. ||| You can enter your house fully justified.

idiom: 腑 に 落ちる ない
jp_contexts: どうも腑に落ちない ||| 腑に落ちない ||| 何か腑に落ちない ヘリコプターは着陸しようとしてる どうするの？
english_translations: Something's off. ||| I don't know, Castle. ||| Something doesn't add up. We're dealing with a copycat. What do you mean, the chopper's about to touch down?

jp_contexts: 腕が立つな ||| 奴ら腕が立つから 放っといたら大変な事になる ||| よく腕が立つもんだ
english_translations: You're a capable man. ||| It would have created a huge problem just to let those skilled men run around freely. ||| How'd you get so good?

jp_contexts: で　復讐のために ハッキングの腕を磨いたのか？ ||| どうやって腕を磨いた？ ||| 違う　腕を磨いてるんだわ
english_translations: So, did you ever consider using your hacking skills to get revenge? ||| So how is it that you wind up where you've ended up? ||| No... they're gonna put their skills to work.

jp_contexts: しっかり腰を据えて 働いておくれ ||| 腰を据える ||| 諜報部からの連絡では 夜のうちに 北ベトナム軍は撤退 川向うに腰を据えたらしい
english_translations: Sit your ass down and get yourself to work. ||| Settle in. ||| Intelligence passed the word down that during the night the NVA had pulled out of our area to positions across the Perfume River.

idiom: 腰 を 落ち着ける
jp_contexts: 誰もがディナーのために腰を落ち着ける。 ||| ゆっくり腰を落ち着けて デザートを食べる時間もあるじゃないか？ ||| どの星に 腰を落ち着けるかな
english_translations: Everybody's settling in for dinner. ||| So does this mean that you can actually sit down and have some dessert? ||| Any thoughts on where I should set up shop?

jp_contexts: （吉森） 一人前に扱われないのは 腹が立つが それはいつものことだ 今に始まったことじゃねえー ||| あなたは　腹が立って 裏切られたとさえ思ったでしょうね ||| 〈腹が立った〉
english_translations: Not being able to handle an adult makes one angry but... That's normal., It's not the first time... ||| You must have felt angry, betrayed, even. ||| Mostly pissed off.

jp_contexts: お互い腹を割って本音を明かす ことなんかできるのか... ||| 腹を割って話そう ||| 腹を割って話しに来た
english_translations: Can you reveal each other's true intentions in a heart to heart...? ||| Perhaps a more visceral demonstration. ||| You... you came here to lay the cards on the table.

jp_contexts: 猛ふぶきで ランタンを持ち 腹を立てていた ||| 腹を立てたのね ||| 気が動転したり 腹を立てた時だけで 何かで興奮状態になった時だ
english_translations: He was holding a lantern and he was in the blizzard, and I knew he was gonna be angry. ||| and took offense. ||| Only when they're upset, pissed off, you know, emotional in some way.

idiom: 腹 を 肥やす,私腹 を 肥やす
jp_contexts: 私腹を肥やすのに忙しいのさ ||| 自分の私腹を肥やす事しか 考えていないだろ ||| あんたが私腹を肥やすことも...
english_translations: They're lining their pockets as fast as they can. ||| All you ever think about is fattening your own coffers. ||| And that pretty little nest you feathered for yourself.

jp_contexts: 腹黒い奴はいた。 ||| つまり　腹黒い毒島よりも １０倍　もっと腹黒い。 ||| ３人は綺麗でした でも心は腹黒く汚かった
english_translations: But there was someone black-hearted. ||| Meaning he's 10 times more black-hearted than the black-hearted Busujima. ||| All three were beautiful of face, but vile and black of heart.

jp_contexts: 臆面もなく でたらめを言える奴だ ||| 臆面もなく嘘を？ ||| ここに私達が堂々と 座ってられるなんて信じられる 臆面も無くよ?
english_translations: Someone who can bullshit their way out of anything. ||| No, no, no. You lie to my fucking face? ||| Can you believe we're sitting out here in the open bold as brass?

jp_contexts: いいや 自業自得だ ||| ウォルシュは 気の毒に見えるが 自業自得なんだ ||| 自業自得よ
english_translations: No, I earned what I got coming to me. ||| And I know it seems a bit rough on Walshy, but don't forget he made this rod for his own back. ||| Paid the ultimate price.

jp_contexts: それは皆言うの 「お互いに色目を使う」？ ||| 色目を使ってくる男を あしらうのは簡単なのよ ||| 彼に色目を使ってるなら
english_translations: Is that what people say, to "make eyes at each other"? ||| See, it's really easy to get over with the testosterone at work, you know? ||| And if she's making those eyes at him,

jp_contexts: うるさくしすぎると 成長の芽を摘むかと ||| - 早く芽を摘まないといけない -　やめろ! ||| 彼等が力を持ち始める前に 芽を摘むのよ
english_translations: The thing is, constant warnings are maddening for anyone aspiring to be an overlord. ||| - I can put her out of her misery. ||| It's time to eliminate them before they grow any stronger.

jp_contexts: 若気の至りが バッチリ写ってます ||| 最後の若気の至りだ ||| 若気の至りを俺もしたぜ クライドはまだガキか？
english_translations: The height of youthful folly ||| Making peace with past indiscretions. ||| Made the same mistake when I was a kid. So is Clyde still your dude?

jp_contexts: ヘプタポットは複雑な文を 苦もなく２秒で書く ||| 彼らは漫然と生きる 苦もなくね ||| ［彼は対立や逆境を］ ［苦もなく処理できると言うけれども］
english_translations: A heptopod can write a complex sentence in two seconds, effortlessly. ||| They drift through life effortlessly. ||| He says he deals with conflict and adversity easily, though.

jp_contexts: 出てきて自由になったから 英気を養ってるんだな ||| これ、英気を養うよ ||| え ええ... 英気を養わなきゃ
english_translations: So, Jake, you're out. You're free. You're rehabilitated. ||| Here. It will restore your energy. ||| - Uh, yeah, uh, sleep is good.

jp_contexts: 一人でドロイドを片づける のは荷が重いからな ||| 年寄りには荷が重い ||| 荷が重いから渡したいのに
english_translations: Very well. The burden is on me not to destroy all the droids until you arrive. ||| I'm getting too old for this sort of thing. ||| If you did, I'd be tempted to give it to you.

jp_contexts: このバーガーを投げ入れて 薬が効くのを待つんだ ||| 薬が効いて来た とにかく急ごう! ||| 薬が効くまで時間がかかる

jp_contexts: ジメチル・スルホキシドと 混ざった場合 麻酔薬になる ||| 狂気は現代では 薬になり得る ||| ずっと彼の研究をしてるんだ 適切に希釈さえすればその毒は... とても有効な薬になる
english_translations: Hey, if sophorine is mixed with dimethyl sulfoxide, it becomes an anesthetic. ||| Madness can be a medicine for the modern world. ||| I've been studying him, and I'm pretty sure that his venom could be quite useful if properly diluted.

jp_contexts: 彼は虚勢を張ってると思うの ||| いや　トレメイン・アレクサンダーは 虚勢を張らない ||| 彼女は虚勢を張っている
english_translations: I think he's bluffing. ||| No, Tremaine Alexander don't bluff. ||| She's bluffing.

idiom: 虫 の 居所 が 悪い
jp_contexts: 今日はずっと虫の居所が悪いな ||| 今日は虫の居所が悪いのよ ||| 虫の居所が悪かっただけ
english_translations: All right something's been bugging you all day. ||| Short fuse today I guess. ||| Look, I had a bad moment. That's all.

idiom: 虫 の 知る せる
jp_contexts: -虫の知らせだけど ||| 虫の知らせの為に 私のキャリアを危険に晒せと? ||| 貴方にも 何か 虫の知らせがあったはず
english_translations: I'm telling you, Chad. ||| And you expect me to risk my entire career on a hunch? ||| You already have a hunch something's wrong, Chad.

jp_contexts: 蚊帳の外に放り出すなよ ||| 組合は蚊帳の外さ ||| 裁判官と主席弁護士が密談を 我々は蚊帳の外だ
english_translations: Promise me that you'll let me be there. ||| The association wasn't consulted. ||| Only the judge and the lead attorneys were privy, and our honorable D.A. is staying mum.

jp_contexts: あなたは、融通が利かなく なってきています、フレイア ||| 融通が利かないな ||| 大統領は融通が利かない
english_translations: You've become quite literal, Freya. ||| I thought you said he was cool. ||| The president's bulldog.

jp_contexts: 彼の目を見て 血の涙が ||| 妙よね 血の涙なんてある？ ||| -　そして彼らの妻達は 血の涙を流すでしょう"
english_translations: Now, if you look into his eyes, you can see him tearing blood. ||| I'd say bad day all around. I mean, can-- can someone actually cry blood? ||| "... and their wives will weep tears of blood."

idiom: 血 も 涙 も ない
jp_contexts: 血も涙もない ||| ドラゴ・ブラッドビストは いかれた奴だ 血も涙もない ||| あんたは血も涙もない上にバカよ
english_translations: A cold blooded setup. ||| Because Drago Bludvist is a madman... without conscience or mercy. ||| You are cruel and ignorant.

jp_contexts: あんたらは、スタークと血を分けた仲だろ？ ||| 血を分けた娘... ||| これは私の血を分けた兄弟だ
english_translations: Your people share blood with the Starks, don't they? ||| My flesh and blood. ||| This is my blood brother.

jp_contexts: ジークフリートを作ったのは 彼ら二人だ ヴェルズングの血を引いた最強の 男子を ||| ウィリアム・ターナーの血を引く 本当の子供はどこだ？ ||| 一族の人がオオカミの血を 引いてるって知ってた？
english_translations: Siegfried was born of their union, a youth of invincible strength. ||| The child in whose veins flows the blood of William Turner? Where? ||| Did you know Quileutes are supposedly descended from wolves?

jp_contexts: あの谷では袋の鼠じゃ セオデンは罠に踏み込んどる ||| 俺達は袋の鼠だ ||| 袋の鼠だ
english_translations: There is no way out of that ravine. Théoden is walking into a trap. ||| We're trapped. ||| We're trapped.

idiom: 裏 で 糸 を 引く,糸 を 引く
jp_contexts: あんたが裏で糸を引いてんの？ ||| サーセイが裏で糸を引いている 知ってるだろ ||| 裏で糸を引き 凶悪犯を創り上げる
english_translations: Are you the one who did this? ||| Cersei has manipulated everything and you know it. ||| You simply rule from behind the scenes.

jp_contexts: 私は　裏に回った ||| 裏に回ろう ||| 5分待ち 裏に回り 裏口を包囲
english_translations: I went around back. ||| Let's go in the back. ||| Wait five minutes. Go around and block the side entrance.

jp_contexts: レンタカーだけでなく 彼は何とか人の裏をかいてる ||| 裏をかくことができる 前にもやった ||| 現場では常に― こちらの裏を かこうとする敵が相手だ

jp_contexts: 俺は銀行に当たって 裏を取る ||| 私もそう思いたくない 私が裏を取ります ||| 引っ張って来い 裏を取ろう
english_translations: I'll talk to the bank, make sure it wasn't a mistake. ||| Paul, I don't like it any more than you do, but I'll prove it. ||| Bring her in. See what you get.

jp_contexts: 君に2つの顔があるなら 裏目に出るぞ ||| もし話して裏目に出たら？ ||| 互いに対してそれらをピットにあなたの策略 だから、資格でした 完全に裏目に出たようです。
english_translations: The problem is when you're two people at the same time, one of them is bound to trip the other. ||| What if Joe is right, and I tell them, and it backfires? ||| Your ploy to pit them against each other seems to have backfired completely so that could qualify, yes.

idiom: 見果てる ぬ 夢
jp_contexts: 見果てぬ夢と言っていた。 ||| 見果てぬ夢に見えると言っていた。 ||| 見果てぬ夢という像は、サンタ・リタにある。
english_translations: She said it was a lost cause. ||| She said she could see it was a lost cause. ||| The patron saint of lost causes is saint rita.

jp_contexts: 見栄を張るのは あまり好きじゃない ||| あの方は美しいわ　あなたは見栄を 張らないようにすればいいの　虚栄心は罪よ ||| 見栄を張ることは決して賢くないというね わかったかい？
english_translations: Ostentation is not something that I'm accustomed to. ||| She is beautiful. You shouldn't be vain. Vanity is a sin. ||| This is a good lesson on why you never wanna lie about your ability to do things you clearly can't do, okay?

idiom: 視線 を 浴びる
jp_contexts: 私は、メール室で90分間 郵便の仕分けを待ってたのよ。 胸元に視線を浴びながら。 だから、私がキャットに これを渡します。 ||| 彼はみんなの視線を浴びてる ||| - 俺も息子も　視線を浴びるんだ
english_translations: I spent the last 90 minutes in the mail room letting a glorified postal worker stare at my chest, so I could be the one to give this to Cat. ||| Everyone's staring machine guns at him. ||| People would look at me and see him. That must have been very difficult for you.

jp_contexts: 私は覚悟の上で参った 首を刎ねられる事も ドラゴンに焼かれる事も ||| 彼らは覚悟の上だ！ ||| 多少の危険は覚悟の上よ
english_translations: And I came here knowing that you could have your men behead me or your dragons burn me alive. ||| They know that going in! ||| To me, that's worth a little risk.

jp_contexts: まあ　やるとしても 親身になって話を聞く人が必要だ ||| デイブは親身になってくれてる ||| 誰が親身になってくれる？
english_translations: Well, if ever you need a friendly ear. ||| I think Dave is really helping you. ||| Who in your estimation is that sympathetic ear?

idiom: 言う なれる ば
jp_contexts: - 言うなれば... ||| 言うなれば、 災い転じて、福となる ||| 彼女は、言うなれば 気晴らしの叱責の提供者 好きな連中は 喜んで金を払う
english_translations: No. ||| What a, what do you call it, a poetic turn of events. ||| She provides, shall we say, recreational scolding for those who enjoy that sort of thing and are prepared to pay for it.

idiom: 言葉 に 甘える
jp_contexts: お言葉に甘えて ||| お言葉に甘えます ||| お言葉に甘えたいけど悪いわよ
english_translations: He convinced me. ||| If you insist. ||| Oh, that's really sweet of you to offer, Rarity, but I can't let you do that.

jp_contexts: 我々全員を子供と呼んだのです 言葉の綾です ||| 言葉の綾というやつなのね？ ||| それは言葉の綾か？
english_translations: I believe he's calling all of us children. Figure of speech. ||| So, it was a figure of speech? ||| Is that another figure of speech?

jp_contexts: お言葉を返すようだが 失せろ ||| 言葉を返せば 相手が消えても 反応する ||| 言葉を返して申し訳ないが　今は 詳細な情報を口にすべき 時期でもないし場所でもない
