jp_contexts: おまえは冷ややかで 計算高いよ ||| 計算高い　恐いんだ ||| 計算高く 特に 犠牲を厭わないことが必要なのだと
english_translations: You were cold and calculating. ||| She's insanely jealous, she's irrational, and I'm frightened of her. ||| calculating, and most of all... willing to sacrifice.

jp_contexts: 君は 話が分かりそうだ ||| 協力する限り、俺は話が分かる男だ、 一言聞くぜ、リック。 ||| 救世主は話が分かるんだ。
english_translations: Maybe you can talk some sense into these people's. ||| I'm a very reasonable man as long as you cooperate, so let me ask you a question, Rick. ||| Saviors can actually be quite reasonable.

jp_contexts: 話が合うよ ||| 話が合ってきましたね ||| ここから数マイルの所でね 君たちと話が合うかもしれん
english_translations: For you, I think they'd make an exception. ||| Now you're speaking my language. ||| Yeah, he lives a few miles from here. He may be able to help you.

jp_contexts: その通り 話が早いですね ||| 話が早くていい ||| プリンスさんのおかげで 話が早い
english_translations: Yes. We understand each other very well. ||| We appreciate your discretion, as always. ||| Their presence has been decisive, Mister Prince, to encourage her.

jp_contexts: 話が違います あのとき全ての... ||| 鳥と人間は話が違うよ ||| それとこれとは話が違う
english_translations: That's not what you said. you said all... ||| Recently dead bird? That's one thing. Dead person? ||| Look, you can't be doing this right now.

idiom: 話 に なる ない
jp_contexts: 話にならない 私は・・・ ||| あなたじゃ話にならない 腹ペコよ ||| 正気じゃない それは話にならない
english_translations: That's ridiculous. I can't be expected to... ||| You won't let me do anything and I'm so hungry. ||| You're out of your mind. No way. That's out of the question.

jp_contexts: よし　話に乗る ||| デネットは話に乗った ||| もっと大きな声で そしたら話に乗ろう
english_translations: OK, I'll bite. ||| Dennett's on board. ||| A bit louder, my dear, and we can dance to it.

jp_contexts: 伺って 話を詰めてきてください ||| （仲谷）お２人には もう少し 話を詰めてから お伝えします ||| 実は今 ﾌｫｽﾀｰの極東ｴﾘｱﾏﾈｰｼﾞｬｰと 会って話を詰めてるんだが
english_translations: Go talk to them and finalize the deal. ||| I'll let you know after we've talked more. ||| I'm meeting with Foster's Far East Area Manager and working out some details.

jp_contexts: 調子がいいサインだよ ジェームスにとってはね ||| 今夜は調子がいいな オレはちょっとトイレまで ||| 僕は　君と一緒にいた方が　調子がいい
english_translations: Good sign, actually. Means he's stoked. ||| You're having a good night. Mm-hmm. Okay, I am now gonna take the long walk to the little boy's room. ||| I am... better with you, Watson.

jp_contexts: 席は１つだけだ 調子に乗るなよ マリア ||| 証拠はない 調子に乗るな ||| 調子に乗りすぎたよ この年頃の小さな子供ってこうだろう
english_translations: You get one of those as captain, but don't push your luck, Maria. ||| No proof, but you're not innocent yet! So let me defend you and stay quiet... ||| I shouldn't have encouraged her, but you know what little children are like these days.

idiom: 調子 を 合わせる
jp_contexts: 2,3分は調子を合わせるんです でも... すぐに仕事に戻りました ||| それで なんで調子を合わせる フィンチ? ||| 君と私は長い間友情をもってやってきた、 触れることなく、だが音のように、 いつも君に心の調子を合わせていると感じていた。
english_translations: And he'd play along for a few minutes, but... then he'd leave for work. ||| So why'd you even play along, Finch? ||| You and I went so long in our friendship without ever touching, yet I always felt attuned to you.

jp_contexts: 諸刃の剣だよ ||| 張り込みでの水分補給は どっちみち諸刃の剣だ ||| このやり方は諸刃の剣だぞ
english_translations: Perception's a tool that's pointed on both ends. ||| Hydrating on a stakeout is a double-edged sword anyway. ||| This little game cuts both ways.

jp_contexts: 豹変したのだと　もっぱらの噂だ ||| 彼の目が 瞳が豹変して ||| だが、豹変するだろう
english_translations: People say he's changed. ||| His eyes were different. ||| You wait till it turns ugly.

jp_contexts: - 上層部はあなたに責めを負わせたの？ ||| 爆破を仕掛けるのは　君だが 責めを負うのは　ＥＬＭだ ||| 身代わりに　責めを負うこと
english_translations: They're letting you take the fall? ||| You get the blast, they get the blame. ||| A scapegoat.

jp_contexts: 汚れ役を買って出なきゃ いけなかったりもすると思うの ||| 会社が買って出た？ ||| 金のためなら　患者を どんな危険な目に遭わせようと→ オペを買って出る。
english_translations: I think it means you might have to take on the dirty job at times. ||| Harbinger sponsored that? ||| She volunteers to take on any operation for money, no matter how great the risk to the patient.

jp_contexts: 顔が赤くなるわ・・・ ||| 赤くなっちゃった このワインのせいね ||| 赤くなった
english_translations: You got me blushing' 'til I... ||| I'm flushed. Must be the wine. ||| Are you blushing?

jp_contexts: リードのお嬢様は堅苦しくて冗談が通じない 地に足が付いてるのかしら ||| あなたは足が付いている ||| だが 君から俺達に足が付くんじゃ？
english_translations: Lady Reed here's got a stick so far up her ass, it's a wonder her feet touch the ground. ||| They might be able to trace the reset signal back to you. ||| Hang on. Wouldn't it be awful if it was traceable back to us?

jp_contexts: - 足が早いのは誰だ？ ||| ケスラーみたいな輩は 逃げ足が早いんだ ||| 雷に撃たれて 足が早くなった青年よ
english_translations: Whoever's the fastest runner. - Who is that? - I am. ||| The quieter we are, the better chance we have in getting him. ||| Struck by lighting? Was in a coma for nine months? Woke up being able to run faster than the speed of sound?

jp_contexts: 足が速い以外に、何か 特技があるといいけど。 ||| 逃げ足が速い！ ！ ？ ||| 我々にはある言い伝えがあった 足が速く．．． 雪のように白い．．．
english_translations: I hope you're bringing more to the table than just quick reflexes. ||| They're getting away! ||| There's a prophecy that tells of a creature, swift of foot white as snow.

jp_contexts: それぞれに足を入れろ　エリック ||| 彼が足を入れた場所に 薬の痕跡が残ってたから ||| 封筒には ウサギの足を入れた
english_translations: One for each leg, Eric. ||| There are still tiny traces of it in the trainers from where he put the cream on his feet. ||| So I put my rabbit's foot in that package.

idiom: 足 を 引っ張る
jp_contexts: 僕の足を引っ張りに 席のあるうちに行かなきゃ! ||| 足を引っ張るな ||| ゲームがこの子の 足を引っ張ってるね
english_translations: Daniel brought in Chad to backstab me-- oh, I mean help me-- and I gotta get to work before he helps me out of a job. ||| To me you're dead weight. ||| Because of this gaming, it pulled him right down.

jp_contexts: 私は書斎から出てきたことはないし 彼女も階段で足を止めたことなどない ||| バギンズ殿 足を止めるんじゃない ||| 足を止めろ
english_translations: I never left my study. Never stopped her on the stairs. ||| Master Baggins... I suggest you keep up. ||| You got to stop tapping.

jp_contexts: 足を洗うんだ 友達は殺された ||| 俺は汚いビジネスから 足を洗うよ ||| １週間前は 足を洗うと言ってただろ
english_translations: Don't do the job. ||| I'm gonna wash my hands of our dirty little business. ||| A week ago you talked like you were all ready to hang it up.

idiom: 足 を 踏み入れる
jp_contexts: 多くの吸血鬼が自分の領土に足を踏み入れたように 多くのクイートも戻ってきた ||| このアントンは うんざりする男だ 地獄の王国に足を踏み入れた ||| 可愛い天才君が 足を踏み入れたんだろ 役員会の連中は 歓迎したか？
english_translations: As more vampires set foot in their territory, more Quileutes turned. ||| This Anton... he may have been a skeevy bloke, but he had a toe in the nether realm, all right. ||| Did you walk in there, do your adorable boy genius thing, and the board of directors was less than impressed?

jp_contexts: 「ヴィン、こんなはした金のために、 オレにここまで足を運ばせないでくれ」 ||| ブログでフラッシュの 活躍を読んでー 今まで事件現場に足を運んだ ||| ＜新しい ショコラティエが オープンして 足を運ばないわけがない＞
english_translations: Vin, don't make me have to come down here again for this. ||| I read your friend Iris' blog post on The Flash, and I visited all the crime scenes you fought at. ||| If a new chocolatier opens up, there's no way she won't stop by.

jp_contexts: 彼にこれ以上足元を見ることを許さず 自分の好意を証明した ||| 足元を見て歩いて ||| 足元を見な
english_translations: You demonstrated your goodwill without allowing him to take further advantage. ||| Woman: How 'bout, this time, you watch where you're going? ||| Thanks for dropping by.

idiom: 足止め を 食らう
jp_contexts: 私の隊を送ったが ドイツ軍に足止めを食らっている ||| うちらがアウター・リムで足止めを食らった ||| 船が故障して 直るまで 足止めを食らってるのよ
english_translations: Jerry took them out. ||| We have been stranded out here without any help at all. ||| Our ship was damaged, and we're stranded here until we can repair it.

jp_contexts: 6ドルじゃ路頭に迷う ||| 俺がいなきゃ姉一家は路頭に迷ってた ―そうなの？ ||| 我々 メガバンクは 絶対に つぶれてはいけないんだ それだけは死守せねばならない もし つぶれでもしたら 何百万人 何千万人が 路頭に迷うか 分かってますか？
english_translations: Six dollars an hour puts my family on the street. ||| If I wasn't there, they'd be on the street. ||| Our mega-bank cannot collapse. do you know how many millions of people will be out in the cold? some sacrifice is inevitable.

idiom: 躍起 に なる て
jp_contexts: 誰かがすでに盗んでた たぶん 誰かが 捕まえるのに躍起になってる ||| 小さな町で行方不明の女の子 皆が躍起になって探す ||| あんたの部下が　この電話を辿ろうと 躍起になってるなら 落ち着くように言ってくれ
english_translations: Someone had already jacked it, perhaps someone who's out to get him. ||| Missing girl in a small town would throw up all kinds of red flags. ||| If your men are scrambling to trace this call, you can tell them to relax.

jp_contexts: "穏やかな夜に 身を任せるな" ||| 気高い貴方に恥知らずに身を任せた ||| 俺に身を任せろ
english_translations: Do not go gentle into that good night ||| Flee from the corpse of one who unworthily gave herself to a man of honour ||| I need you to trust me.

jp_contexts: ついにジェイソンも 身を固めるか？ ||| 長男がついに身を固めた ||| この春　自分　身を固めようと思いまして
english_translations: So is this it? She the one gonna take jason stackhouse Off the market for good? ||| My elder son is finally taken! ||| My girlfriend and I, we're thinking of settling down.

jp_contexts: どこに身を寄せた ||| 各地から逃れたドゥネダインが- タウアディルに身を寄せた ||| 私に身を寄せなければ 安全じゃない
english_translations: Where'd you go? Who took you in? ||| Taurdal filled as many of the Dúnedain fled their homes and sought safety in numbers. ||| And now I know my son is not safe unless he's by my side.

jp_contexts: どのように奇妙な 私はルシファーが軌道に乗ることができない ||| ラグランジュポイントを越えて軌道に乗るよ、 無事に、ハーシェル(火星のクレーター)へ。 ||| 一連のすべてが軌道に乗ってるか... 評価したいだけだ
english_translations: How strange I can't get Calcifer going ||| The trajectory will take it beyond the Lagrange point so that it doesn't hit Herschel. ||| I am merely trying to assess just how close this train is hugging the tracks.

jp_contexts: アーノルドと同じ轍を踏むな ||| 導かれる答えは一つ... だが 昨夜と同じ轍を踏まないように より多くの情報を収集した― ゆえに 遅れたわけだ ||| 頼む、同じ轍を踏むな、いいな？
english_translations: You mustn't make Arnold's mistake. ||| The clues point in one direction, but to avoid repeating last night's debacle I was obliged to collect more sufficient data, hence my tardiness. ||| Please, don't go down this road again, ok?

jp_contexts: まるで -- 辻褄が合わない ||| 辻褄が合わないわ ||| "そうか" じゃ無い 辻褄が合わない
english_translations: It looks like-- It doesn't add up. ||| And it makes no sense. ||| No, no, not okay, it doesn't make sense.

jp_contexts: 迷宮入り事件を調べるように言え ||| 無線を切って　その迷宮入りの件の調査を 俺のとこに送ってくれ ||| 全部迷宮入り事件だ
english_translations: Tell him to go over cold cases. ||| Sign off on the cold cases, and have them sent to me. Right. ||| Cold cases.

idiom: 逃がす た 魚 は 大きい
jp_contexts: 逃がした魚は大きいですよ ||| あっ そうか　悪かった 逃がした魚は大きいぞ ||| 逃がした魚は大きいわ
english_translations: You don't know what you're missing. ||| Oh. Yeah, okay, yeah. Too bad. ||| The one that got away.

idiom: 逃げる も 隠れる も する ない
jp_contexts: 私は逃げも隠れもしない ||| 俺は逃げも隠れもしない ||| 逃げも隠れもしない
english_translations: I don't believe in the hidden ball trick. ||| I won't run and hide, you understand? ||| I'm right here.

idiom: 逃げる 腰 に なる
jp_contexts: 私が笑いかけても 逃げ腰になるの ||| 逃げ腰にならなくてもいいよ ワイリーがセキュリティー面は ||| いざ愛を告白されると 逃げ腰になる
english_translations: He starts backing away if I even smile at him. ||| Don't be defeatist. ||| I mean, why is it that we all need to be loved but then when somebody finally says, "I love you," people just run scared.

idiom: 途方 に 暮れる
jp_contexts: 途方に暮れてる ||| 俺は 見たくない お前が イラつき 途方に暮れる姿を... ||| 途方に暮れたよ 子連れで文無し 定職もない
english_translations: clueless on the floor. ||| I don't wanna see you wake up one day all old and pissed off realising you're lost. ||| I didn't know how I was going to manage with a small boy, with no money and no regular job.

jp_contexts: 明るい見通しを持てないというのなら 心臓を調べてもらったほうがいいでしょう。 なぜなら、途方もない見事な素晴らしい猛然と突き進む、 この世界の人々の集団が、何とかしようと 取り組んでいるのですから。 ||| やっぱり全世界一 セクシーなのは... 途方もない銃を 持つ美女だな ||| -　サットンは途方もない悪だった
english_translations: because there is an extraordinary, beautiful, gorgeus, fierce group of people in this world, who are taking this on. ||| There is nothing more sexy in the whole world than a beautiful woman with an incredible gun. ||| - Sutton was a much greater evil. - Was?

idiom: 遅く れる 早きる れる
jp_contexts: 遅かれ早かれ彼らは 正面を向くだろう ||| 遅かれ早かれ したくない事でも やることになるわ ||| 私たちはビルに居て静かにできるわ でも　遅かれ早かれ私たちは彼らを 引っ張りだすつもりよ
english_translations: Oh, they'll swing around to the front sooner or later. ||| You know, sooner or later, you're gonna have to do something for them you don't want to. ||| We can stay close to the buildings and keep quiet, but sooner or later, we're gonna be drawing 'em.

jp_contexts: 運が向いてきたようね ||| 俺を欲しがってる 運が向いてきたぜ！ ||| - 続けてれば運が向くかも
english_translations: - You ready for me to make your day? ||| They want me. We're going to the big time! ||| - Stay on it. We might get lucky.

jp_contexts: 別動隊のおかげで道が開いた ||| [遠くへの道が　開かれる] ||| 光の中　俺のために道が開いている
english_translations: Weaver's team has bought us a window. The road to the power plant's wide open. We're going in. ||| Can possibly know how far they can go. " ||| I shall revel in that fire! In that fire I shall find my bride!

jp_contexts: 遺書を捜し出す そこから道が開けるでしょう ||| 音を聞いて 本を読めば 僕らの道が開ける ||| いろんな道が開けてきました 両親に教わらなかったことも
english_translations: I'm gonna try to find the will, and then we'll take it from there. ||| Sort some sounds and read the books, and we'll be on our way. ||| It helped expose me to things that my parents or friends didn't show me.

jp_contexts: 人のニーズに 重きを置いてます 鎮痛薬 Pain relief. ||| あなたが映画に重きを置くのが 気掛かりで・・・ ||| ヤツとキャリーが安全な場所で うまくやる可能性より そっちの方に重きを置いた方が いいと思う
english_translations: What we like to focus on is what people really need, pain relief. ||| I am a little concerned at the importance you're placing on movies. ||| I guess I'd weigh that against the likelihood of him and Carrie making it to the safe house at all.

idiom: 金 の なる 木
jp_contexts: 彼はあなたがお金のある ロックスターだと知っていた お金のなる木だと ||| ところで 金の成る木は育つかも知れないが まず見つけるのが難しいのでは？ ||| ハッチは金のなる木でした
english_translations: He knew you were a rock star with money and endless resources. ||| Yeah, well money might grow on trees where you're from but it's a little harder to come by here. ||| Hutch was the golden goose. He brought in hundreds

jp_contexts: だからこう言う資格があると思う そのイヴとは　金輪際　関わっちゃいけない ||| あなたは このつまらぬ一座を 解散し 金輪際　魔女を ||| 金輪際、あの子はいない。
english_translations: So I'm qualified when I say, you must cut this Eve out of your life entirely. ||| You disband this little merry troupe of assholes, vowing never to harm another witch from now until the end of time. ||| She most certainly is not.

jp_contexts: 誰が相手か 釘を刺しただけだ ||| しかもそれが具体化する事のないよう 念入りに釘を刺しておいた ||| あれほど釘を刺したろ
english_translations: I'm just saying they got to know that they're working for you. ||| Furthermore, I was given every assurance it never passed the planning stage. ||| You did exactly what I told you not to do!

jp_contexts: スジーマンスキー刑事は 事件の鍵を握ってる ||| 誰にしろその人が― この試験の鍵を 握ってるのね 名乗り出てよ ||| （テレビの音声） では続いて次のニュースです ルモンド社 贈収賄事件を 捜査中の東京地方検察庁特捜部は 一連の事件の鍵を 握っているとみられる―
english_translations: Detective Szymanski is key to your case. ||| Okay, whoever is holding out could be the key to cracking this exam, so you better speak up now. ||| The Tokyo District Attorney's office special task force, investigating the Lumondo Corp. bribery has announced that they have questioned Sakichi Konuma president of Konuma Industries as a key witness

idiom: 長い 目 だ みる
jp_contexts: 長い目で見れば全然 ||| 長い目で見れば 傷つけたくない　だから - ||| 誓って　長い目で見れば 君はこのことで僕に感謝するよ
english_translations: I mean, in the long run, at all; at all. ||| I don't want to hurt you in the long run, so-- ||| I swear, in the long run, you're gonna thank me for this.

jp_contexts: ビジターに門戸を開くのは 良い事だな ||| だからそう言うビジネスをやる予定なんだ 門戸を開いてね ||| 興奮は冷めやりません 想像を超えた新しい世界へ 門戸を開くのです
english_translations: Establishing ties with the Visitors is a good thing, Jack. ||| I'm gonna form this business and I want everybody to get a shot. ||| Nothing can take away from the excitement... as we open our doors to a nation from beyond our imagination.

idiom: 閑古 鳥 が 鳴く
jp_contexts: 店は閑古鳥が鳴いてる 連中はビルをすぐ手放すさ ||| 学校には 閑古鳥が鳴いています 子供達を家庭に 保護するための 登校拒否が 急増しているからです ||| 閑古鳥が鳴いていた
english_translations: It's like a ghost ship around here. They're gonna be begging to sell this place within a month. ||| Schools stand like mausoleums, their attendance drastically declined, as parents keep their children safely home. ||| A pretty rough drought this past year.

jp_contexts: 間が悪かったか？ ||| お前の墓石には、 こう刻め、 "いつも場違いで、間が悪い" ||| 間が悪すぎる " Ｃ " に踊らされてるみたいだ
english_translations: This a bad time? ||| On your tombstone it should read, "Always in the wrong place at the wrong time." ||| Not great timing for us, we're rather playing into C's hands.

jp_contexts: 私を撃って真実を闇に葬るのか ||| 君とウォルデンは隠蔽工作を 無人爆撃の件を闇に葬った ||| ２年前― この船の真実が 闇に葬られた
english_translations: Or you can shoot me and never know. ||| Only that you and Walden... went to great lengths once before to cover up the drone strike. ||| Well, two years ago, the elephant in the room was this scow.

idiom: 限り を 尽くす
jp_contexts: 可能な限りを尽くす ||| 持てる力の限りを尽くす ||| 慈悲深き主よ 力の限りを尽くし アギーのテレビ受信を 改善したまえ
english_translations: Whatever you can. ||| I'll do everything in my power to keep Nick away from my family. ||| Dear merciful Lord, please do what you can to get a better reception for Aggy's TV.

idiom: 隅 から 隅 まで
jp_contexts: まるで紙上演習みたいに 額のシンボルまで 隅から隅まで酷似してる ||| 隅から隅まで調べたが 何も・・・ ||| 隅から隅まで調べるの
english_translations: It was like a-a dry run on paper, all the way down to the weird symbol that we found on the victim's forehead. ||| Nothing. Our guys went over it from the last bit and pixel. ||| Leave no stone unturned, Dr. Hodgins.

idiom: 雲行き が 怪しい
jp_contexts: 雲行きが怪しい ||| 雲行きが怪しくなると 決まって入院するんだ ||| 雲行きが怪しいな
english_translations: That storm on the horizon that I mentioned, ||| When the going gets rough he always checks into the hospital ||| Okay, this is getting a little weird.

jp_contexts: 面が割れたのは　わたし ||| 面が割れたんだ ||| お前の面が割れてる
english_translations: Nobody saw your face and I shot that dumb prick. ||| You've been compromised. ||| Oh, with your face being all over the news,

jp_contexts: 後ろに戻って、クローンの 面倒を見て ||| 泊まりに来て欲しい時は　言ってね シャーリーンの面倒をみるわ ||| -　子供の面倒を見るべきです
english_translations: Just get in the back and take care of the clones. ||| If you need me to stay over,keep you company... I can babysit charlaine. ||| - Is doing what children do best.

jp_contexts: これで音を上げては 現場では働けないぞ ||| 音を上げさせようとした ||| 一度も音を上げなかった
english_translations: But if you think this is pressure, wait until you're out in the field. ||| Hoping he'd crack up, and just fuck off. ||| That not for a single moment did his courage waver.

idiom: 音 沙汰 が ない
jp_contexts: 音沙汰が無くなる この世から居なくなったみたいに ||| それにより音沙汰がなくなる ||| あまりにも長い間、音沙汰が無いので、心配していた。
english_translations: He goes silent like he fell off the face of the earth. ||| There's no word for this. ||| We were worried when we didn't hear from you for so long.

idiom: 頭 が 上がる ない
jp_contexts: 頭が上がらないようだな ||| 永遠に頭が上がらないわね ||| 俺は一生、 彼に頭が上がらないな
english_translations: Makes you wonder what's going on in that little head of hers. ||| I am indebted to you forever. ||| I expect I'll be in his debt for the rest of my life.

jp_contexts: もし彼女がそれほど冷血でないのなら 頭が下がる思いよ ||| そうだろうな、お前の戦略計画の 広範な経験には頭が下がるよ ||| あなた方　捜査官には 頭が下がるけれど
english_translations: If she weren't so bloodless, you'd really have to take your hat off to her. ||| Of course. We bow to your vast experience in strategic planning. ||| The Agency appreciates everything your people are doing.

jp_contexts: いいかい・・・ 君は頭が切れる ||| このグループは頭が切れる 彼らの行動を彼女は理解できない ||| そんなに頭が切れるなら 何故ここに来たの？
english_translations: Look... you're a bright guy. ||| These groups are clever, blinding her to their actions. ||| Then why'd you come up here if you're so smart?

jp_contexts: おととい資料もらってな クラス全員の名前と写真 ぜんぶ頭に入れたー ||| 頭に入れておきます　ありがとう ||| 地図は頭に入れておけ
english_translations: I got the teaching material 2 days ago. I have memorized all students' names and photos. ||| I put it on my to do list ". Thanks. ||| Next time stay put, you won't need a map.

jp_contexts: ベニーの帽子を壊して 頭に来て攻撃しようとしてたら 彼が粉々になっちゃって 僕のせいじゃないけど 追われる事になって・・・ ||| 頭に来る 見てもらえるか？ ||| ぶん殴ってやりたいよ 頭に来た
english_translations: I was so livid that I attacked Tybalt and he ended up getting smashed, which wasn't my fault, and I was chased out. ||| Give it a rap, will ya? See if you could get it going for me. ||| I'm going to blow this shit right off the mountain right now.

jp_contexts: ロデリック なぜ修道士は 頭を剃るのだろう あんな風に？ ||| 頭を剃るかもしれないって ||| よし　頭を剃るアイディアに ついて語ろう
english_translations: Roderick why do you think them monks shave their heads like that? ||| He said they might have to shave my head. ||| Now, let's talk about that shaved head idea.

jp_contexts: - 頭を下げて ||| 俺達が頭を下げたのはドラゴンだ そしてドラゴンはもう死んだ！ ||| 友よ... 君達は... 誰にも 頭を下げなくていい
english_translations: - Bow your head. ||| It was the Dragons we bowed to and now the Dragons are dead! ||| My friends you bow to no one.

jp_contexts: 頭を冷やしたほうがいいと 思うので。 ||| 頭を冷やそう　ここじゃ無理だ 名前は？ ||| 頭を冷やしてくる
english_translations: I think it's better (when he's) cooled off. A certain somebody. ||| Chill out. Can we just talk about this? What's your name? ||| I need some air.

idiom: 頭 を 切り替える
jp_contexts: 頭を切り替えましょう ||| 先ず あなた方が 頭を切り替え "仕分け達人"になるの ||| 頭を切り替えようとしても
english_translations: You need to disconnect, Boss. ||| So, first we will be installing and training you on a system that we're calling, "The Wizard." ||| I keep turning things around in my mind.

jp_contexts: 頭を振って？ ||| 頭を振るだけでも？ ||| - 頭を振るな
english_translations: Just nod your head? Baby? ||| Can you just nod your head, baby? ||| Don't turn your head!

jp_contexts: ２ポンドでも 頭を痛めてるのに ||| 頭を痛めるとしたら 長引いてる あなたの捜査よ ||| 今　この国が最も 頭を痛めてる問題は？
english_translations: 4 pounds, as if 2 pounds wasn't bad enough. ||| Yours,however,could take a turn for the worse if you don't wrap up this investigation. ||| What bugs you the most about this country?

jp_contexts: だが その年寄りだけが 頼みの綱なんだろう ||| 魔法使いの頼みの綱だ ||| だといい　頼みの綱だ
english_translations: This old man's all you've got. You know that and I know that. ||| It's a wizard's bread and butter, really. ||| I hope so. My best chance of getting back home.

jp_contexts: 三十六国に顔が利くだろう？ ||| 数学クラブにも新聞部にも 顔が利く　ハッカーのメンバーだし ||| VCに顔が利く
english_translations: Aren't you close to the thirty-six nations? ||| I also have my Math Club Card, Hacker Membership, Journalist Pass, ||| - He's got connections to VCs.

jp_contexts: 顔が広いから デルグロスに頼まれた ||| 中東では顔が広い ||| 飲み屋からボストンまで顔が広い人がいる
english_translations: Delgros knew I had their ear, so he offered me money to push things through. ||| I ran many sorts of parts to all sorts of places in the Middle East. ||| He's got the ear of every captain from Bar Harbor to Boston.

jp_contexts: - 顔に出てるぞ ||| 今 君は生きているが 内なる汚れは 顔に出ている ||| 動揺が顔に出る、ですね
english_translations: - It's starting to show. ||| Now in order for you to stay alive we have to match your face with the ugliness of your soul. ||| They make mistakes. Nice.

idiom: 顔 に 書く て ある
jp_contexts: ♪顔に書いてあるよ♪ ||| 顔に書いてある ||| 顔に書いてあるだけさ
english_translations: ♪ Sittin' right on your face ♪ ||| I can see that they haven't. ||| Just what's written on your face.

idiom: 顔 に 泥 を 塗る
jp_contexts: 君たちは約束を破って 私の顔に泥を塗った ||| ソンレンも　男の子を産んだら 誰かの顔に　泥を塗ってしまうわね ||| 誰かが手下のネイサンの 顔に泥を塗った！
english_translations: - You went back on your word, And then you rubbed my face in it. ||| If fourth sister has a son someone will be very unhappy. ||| Someone chases my boy Nate out of the tick tock and puts one in his face!

jp_contexts: パンザーの事件のことで FBIが　至る所に顔を出してくる ||| - その内 顔を出すさ ||| クインシー辺りにゃ 顔を出すなよ
english_translations: FBI's all over us about this, Panzer case. ||| - It'll show up. ||| And you better never show your face around Quincy, you hear me? Okay, come on. Ever!

idiom: 顔 を 合わせる
jp_contexts: んー、いや、直接顔を合わせた方がいい、 そう思うんだ。 ||| 親族が顔を合わせる機会は 何度もあったが― 殺したいとは思っても 殺したことはなかった ||| どうやって お互い顔を合わせる？
english_translations: Mm, no, in person's better, I think. ||| Look, buddy, I'm trying to be objective here, but we've had countless family functions before, and even though we wanted to kill one another, we never did. ||| What do you say we meet?

jp_contexts: （南上）セカンドラインを 具体化するなら あなたの顔を売って おきたかったんだけど ||| 冗談よ さあ顔を売って ||| 判事に顔を売ってきて
english_translations: I wanted people to meet you, since you'll be overseeing the second line. ||| I'm joking. Go make some friends and don't get into trouble. ||| I want the man to know who you are.

jp_contexts: 大姉様の顔を立てることを 知らないのかしら ||| ここで顔を立てるんだ ||| いま ロシアの顔を立てておけば 後で何かと役に立つ
english_translations: How does that make our Big sister feel? ||| You gotta make this look good. ||| Helping the Russians save face is an act of good faith.

jp_contexts: 車で40分のお袋の家に 顔を見せに来るどころか ||| ベイビー　よく顔を見せて ||| 2度と顔を見せるなと言ったのに また帰ってきた こいつと こそこそと...
english_translations: He even has a problem with our mother taking Social Security and Medicare. ||| - Oh my baby! - You're really here. - Let me look at you. ||| I told you never to show your face here again but here you are... snooping around with this...

idiom: 願う て も ない
jp_contexts: それは願ってもない話だ オレはバカじゃないから丁度いい ||| そうなったら願ってもない事だ。 だが、そうなる前に私のチームが私を救出するだろう。 ||| 実際 君の様な人は 願ってもないことだ
english_translations: It's a good thing I'm not a fool, then. ||| Then that's what it'll be, or I hold out until my team comes to find me. ||| I mean, actually, I couldn't have even hoped as much for... Wow. Come on in.

idiom: 風 の 吹き回し
jp_contexts: どういう風の吹き回し？ ||| 一体どういう風の吹き回しだ? ||| どういう風の吹き回しだ？
english_translations: Baby, what's gotten into you? ||| To what do I owe the pleasure? ||| You want me to- How am I supposed to do that?

jp_contexts: 彼のキャリアは風前の灯 その件が露見すると― ||| 俺はここで孤立無援で、 それも風前の灯だ！ ||| 我々の命は風前の灯です
english_translations: Liam's career was already hanging by a thread. ||| I'm out on a limb here, and the limb is going to break! ||| They're blowing it.

jp_contexts: そうですか　お風邪を引かないように 気をつけてくださいね ||| 僕 風邪を引いたので ティッシュはペンで取って ||| 風邪を引くわ 着替えないと
english_translations: I see, well... take care not to catch a cold. Thank you. ||| But I'd push the tissues off with a pen, if I were you, because I've had a cold. ||| He should get out of them wet clothes. He'll get sick.

jp_contexts: 航空機のエンジンも修理する 食えない物も調理する ||| あいつは食えない奴だ ||| 君は本当に食えない女だな
english_translations: They also fix airplane engines and cook bad food. ||| Well, george is capable of a lot of things. ||| You are so full of shit, Patty.

jp_contexts: 暴力団同士の抗争が続くと 私は首になる ||| 「仕事を首になって アパートから追い出された」 ||| お前が首になったのは お前自身のせいだ
english_translations: Brass are gonna fire me just as soon as this gang war cools off. ||| "I got fired from my job. I got kicked out of my apartment." ||| I didn't lose your job for you, Wade, you did that.

jp_contexts: 首を振るな ||| 首を振って去る ||| これからは うなずくか、首を振るだけでいいわ わかった？
english_translations: Don't shake your head at me. ||| Oh go on, then: shake your head and walk out. ||| So, from now on, just nod or shake your head, okay?

idiom: 首 を 突っ込む
jp_contexts: 何でも首を突っ込む あのオバサンが悪いの ||| おたくの領域に 首を突っ込むつもりはないんですよ ||| 首を突っ込みすぎだ
english_translations: Don't feel sorry for yelling at that snoopy old bitch. She's been sticking her nose where it don't belong. ||| We're not looking to horn in on your turf. ||| If you stick your neck out how far?

idiom: 首 を 長い する
jp_contexts: 首を長くして　提灯を待ってる人も いるんだよ ||| 首を長くして待ってたわ 結局パパはあきらめたけど ||| 彼は君を首を長くして待っているぞ
english_translations: There are others desperate for a foot massage, you know. ||| We waited and waited. Finally dad gave up ||| he's been waiting for you a real long time,man.

jp_contexts: 骨がありそうな男だな ||| 僕の ビジネスパートナーなら 気骨がある所を 見せてみろ！ ||| 彼女は鉄の気骨がある
english_translations: You look like the kind of man who'd put his mettle to it. ||| If you are to become my business partner, Macduff, you've got to start showing some backbone! ||| That girl has an iron backbone.

jp_contexts: この作業は― 骨が折れそうだ ||| 取り調べは徹底的で 骨が折れ 退屈な作業だ ||| 強敵を見つけるには 骨が折れるが
english_translations: The chances of this working... are remote at best. ||| The checking of the suspects had been thorough, painstaking, and tedious. ||| Though, you know, finding a worthy opponent has been a little challenging.

jp_contexts: あそこに骨を埋める気は ||| 僕は移住はしない この国に骨を埋める ||| せっかくですが私は この銀行に 骨を埋める所存でおります
english_translations: Not left out there to rot. ||| No, I reject this idea of abandoning my country. ||| but I intend to stay at this bank for the rest of my career.

jp_contexts: 化学療法だけでなく アリバイ工作も高くつき― ||| ‐クリーニング代は高くつくぞ ‐行くぞ ||| 高くつく・・・
english_translations: After completing my first round of treatment and financing the world's most expensive alibi? ||| - My dry-cleaning bill will be ridiculous. - Come on. ||| It's just that he's a fortune to get here and...

jp_contexts: 彼は軍事兵器システムを ハッキングして オークションハウスのように 高く買う落札者順に ||| 「他にも、もっと高く買ってくれる人がいるかも」 ||| 高く買うヤツを知ってる
english_translations: Began selling data to the highest bidder like it was some sort of auction house or something. ||| I bet someone else would pay more. ||| I know a guy that'll pay premium for this kind of crap.

jp_contexts: でも　私は黙って高みの見物だわ ||| 皆が競争するのを 君は高みの見物してた ||| 花火に火をつけて　高みの見物？
english_translations: But you know I'm still on the fence at best. ||| You went high when everyone else stayed on the trail. ||| Light the blue touchpaper and then retire?

jp_contexts: あきらめろ　高嶺の花だ ||| おまえには　高嶺の花だ ||| アンジェラの事は忘れろよ お前には高嶺の花だ
english_translations: That woman is out of your league. She's just too classy for you. ||| You are way out of your league. ||| Will you forget about Angela? She's a bad investment.

jp_contexts: ＦＢＩは鬼門だったな ||| （男性）鬼門って言われてんだから うちは ||| あの山は鬼門だ
english_translations: Well, that was when the team made video games, not weapons. ||| They say it's our fault. ||| That mountain is evil.

jp_contexts: 魔が差したの ||| 人は魔が差して 危険を犯すものです ||| 魔が差したんでしょう
english_translations: And this was such a rush. ||| People are playing with fire and risk everything for nothing. ||| One weak moment, and you saw a way out.

jp_contexts: 鳥肌が立ってます。 ||| 鳥肌が立ってきた ||| 鳥肌が立ったわ
english_translations: I've got goosebumps. ||| I'm getting goosebumps. ||| I got goose bumps, like.

idiom: 鵜呑み に する
jp_contexts: 何でも鵜呑みにするな ||| そんな噂を鵜呑みにするな ||| 鵜呑みにするか しないかだ
english_translations: Jo, just 'cause he says it doesn't make it true. ||| Don't believe those rumors, man. ||| You just have to believe us or think that we're crazy.

jp_contexts: 戦いをやり抜くには 信奉者を鼓舞するの ||| リバー８を鼓舞させたのよ ||| 貴族たちを萎縮させ民を 鼓舞させる支配者
english_translations: Kagame knew to inspire our followers is the only way to ensure our fight outlives us. ||| - He inspired Liber8. ||| A monarch who can intimidate the high lords and inspire the people.

jp_contexts: 鼻が高いわ ||| 鼻が高い　これで ワシを食べなきゃな ||| マスター・スカイウォーカーは鼻が高いでしょう
english_translations: So important. ||| So smart, Mary Ann. Ha! ||| Master Skywalker should be proud.

idiom: お 呼ぶ だ ない
jp_contexts: 俺達はお呼びじゃ無い ||| お呼びじゃないんだよ！ ||| "私はお呼びじゃ無い" それは分かる
english_translations: We are not needed. ||| And you're not welcome! ||| I know I'm not wanted.

jp_contexts: 高尚な話をしてる割には あんたは　人を食い物にする 薬物中毒以外の何者でもない ||| 孤独な老人を 食い物にした 人でなしよ！ ||| でもガブリエルは人を食い物にしていた
english_translations: Yeah, for all your high-minded talk, you're nothing but a predator and a drug addict. ||| She was lonely and vulnerable, and you exploited her, you heartless shit! ||| But Gabriel was a predator.

idiom: 手 を 合わせる
jp_contexts: 今日は この面接のために 神に祈ったりはしていません 手を合わせて 今ある命に 感謝しただけです ||| 手を合わせて悔い改めましょう ||| 手を合わせて フレディ・デントンのために 祈ってください
english_translations: Today I didn't beg God for this job, just thanked him for this life ||| Put your hands together in contrition. ||| Now, you go home, clasp hands and pray for Freddy Denton's poor soul.

jp_contexts: すっかり気が抜けて 注意を怠った　それが敗因だ ||| 何か気が抜けちゃったって言うか ||| そういう種類の友情は 気が抜けないものになるな。
english_translations: You stopped paying attention. And that's where you lost. ||| I was discouraged by it, I mean... ||| That kind of friendship can keep you on your toes.

jp_contexts: どうかな　どんなふうに 効き目があるか分からない ||| 俺にはそういう才能を見抜く目があるんだ。 ||| シルヴィアって 召使を選ぶ目があるのよ
english_translations: I don't know. I don't see how that's gonna work. ||| And I pride myself for having an eye for that kind of talent. ||| Sylvia is so clever. She finds wonderful servants. I don't know how she manages.

jp_contexts: 裏切られ 血を見ることになる！ ||| 彼女はその日 多くの血を見た。 ||| 奴らを俺達に近づけるな さもなくば、血を見ることになる
english_translations: When they turn on us -- and they will -- that blood is gonna be on your hands! ||| She saw a lot of hurt that day. ||| You'd better keep them away from us... or there will be bloodshed.

jp_contexts: わかった、じゃあ頭から ||| 2003初頭からMIA 戦死者扱いだった だが もう違う ||| ３年生の頭から 監督に謝りに行って
english_translations: All right. From the top. ||| MIA since early 2003 and presumed dead... until now. ||| So at the beginning of my third year... I went and apologized to my coach and asked to start all over again.

jp_contexts: 彼らの為に骨を折った事がある、 法的に言えば、5年の刑のを。 ||| 君を弁護するとすれば、 君が何も見えない様に私が骨を折ったのだ。 ||| 一つ骨を折ってみよう
english_translations: Oh, I've been pulling their chestnuts out of the fire, legally speaking, for five years. ||| In your defense, I worked very hard to blind you. ||| I will see what we can do.

jp_contexts: 何を心配してるの 純資産が　標的になるの？ ||| 世界刑事裁判所の代表として 標的になるのが私の役目だ ||| 限界を見失う前に 標的になる前に
english_translations: What, are you worried that your net worth makes you a target? ||| the head of the world criminal court, it would make sense for me to be a target. ||| Before you lose your edge, before you become a target.

jp_contexts: それ聞いたあと学校に 行く息子の身になってもみろって ||| 弁護側は "被告の身になって" と言うでしょう ||| だから 誰かの 身になって考えるなら どうか グロリアさんの 身になって考えて
english_translations: Imagine going to school with that in your head. ||| The defense would have you walk in his client's shoes. ||| So if you are gonna put yourself in anyone's shoes... put yourself... in Gloria Mitchell's.

idiom: あっ と 言う せる
jp_contexts: もしこれが本当に最後のチャンスなら、 何かあっと言わせるようなものを見つけないと。 ||| - 違うんだ - あっと言わせたくて
english_translations: If this really is your last chance, we need to find you something spectacular. ||| You're just trying to make me say something nice.

idiom: いい よう だ する
jp_contexts: （哲希） プハーッ そりゃそうだ このまんまだと うちのクラスは 吉森のいいようにされちまうね ||| 奉公に行かなくていいようにする
english_translations: Well, that's right. If this continues, it will only benefit Yoshimori. ||| I promise thee, you'll need not leave to serve the Tildens nor any family else.

jp_contexts: 私たちにお誂え向きの仕事だわ ||| お誂え向きだわ
english_translations: So we've got our work cut out for us. ||| We're not going to get a better window.

jp_contexts: 前回までのFringe... そ知らぬ顔で 成りすましたせいでしょ ||| そ知らぬ顔で 私の人生を奪ったせいでしょ
english_translations: Just because you walked in my shoes, don't you think that you know me. ||| Just because you walked in my shoes don't you think for a moment that you know me.

idiom: オブラート に 包む
jp_contexts: オブラートに包んで言おうとしたんだ ||| 社長、これ以下の表現はオブラートに包む方が
english_translations: I'm just- - I'm just trying to wrap my mind around it. ||| Mr. Reid, do you understand that's kind of hitting it delicately?

idiom: レッテル を 貼る
jp_contexts: それでもあんた　有罪にしたい？ なにがなんでも彼女に犯罪者のレッテルを貼りたい ||| あんたは レッテルを貼ってるだけだ
english_translations: You still want to stamp a mark of conviction on her? ||| These are all labels. You just label everything.

idiom: 一 つ 間違える ば
jp_contexts: 一つ間違えれば殺される ||| 一つ間違えば大勢の命が
english_translations: One mistake, I die. ||| We make one mistake, thousands of people die.

idiom: 一 筋縄 で は 行く ない
jp_contexts: いや　お前は一筋縄では行かない ||| - 奴は　一筋縄では行かないからな
english_translations: No, nothing with you is easy. ||| - He's not playing with a straight bat?

jp_contexts: 今夜は特別だ、まず一張羅に着替えろ ||| 彼の一張羅の上着だぞ
english_translations: You have a feast tonight. First change your clothes. ||| He only wears that one damn jacket.

jp_contexts: "教会は 考えられる限りの" あらゆる医療に 多大な努力を払っていますが 心理学的な説明は お祓い前には一笑に付されます ||| 一笑に付され 自分の首を絞めるだけだ
english_translations: The church takes great pains to make sure every conceivable medical or psychological explanation can be ruled out before moving forward. ||| They'd laugh at the truth, and I'd have my head in a noose.

jp_contexts: お前達とは問題を起こしたことがなかった 反逆の一翼を担うまではな ||| 私は偉大な愛国戦争の 一翼を担う事を 誇りに思います
english_translations: I never had a problem with your people... until they became a part of this rebellion. ||| I am proud to be part of this mission in the great patriotic war.

idiom: 三 度 目 の 正直
jp_contexts: うん　三度目の正直ね ||| - 三度目の正直か？
english_translations: Yeah, maybe three times is a charm. ||| "Third time's a charm?"

jp_contexts: 真剣にやれ 下手すると怪我するぞ ||| 下手すると 誰かの人生を台無しに
english_translations: Take this serious, because you can get hurt if you're not strong enough, okay? ||| If I fuck up I can ruin somebody's whole life.

idiom: 下手 を する と
jp_contexts: 今､上手くいってますが下手をすると終わりです ||| 真剣に言ってる 下手をすると これから20年は監獄だぞ
english_translations: Now, we walk in there like this, with this, we're done. ||| Preston, if you're not careful, you're going to spend 20 years in prison.

idiom: 不発 に 終わる
jp_contexts: 花火は不発に終わり 最悪の事態に ||| だが不発に終わった
english_translations: Only Fitzpatrick didn't explode, it was far worse than that. ||| That's the only reason why I'm still here.

jp_contexts: 君が怒る必要は　無い これが世の習いって　やつだ ||| 栄光は長子のもの それが世の習いだが
english_translations: Maybe angry is just the way of the world. ||| You're the elder, you reap the glory. This is the way of the world.

jp_contexts: ああ　だが　あの銃は両刃の剣だ ||| 歯止めとして働きますが 両刃の剣です
english_translations: Yeah, the gun's a double-edged sword, kind of. ||| Besides, he's hot.

jp_contexts: あんな美しい人とは争えない ||| りんごは木から離れた所に落ちない （血統は争えない）
english_translations: I cannot vie with such beauty and such sorrow. ||| The apple doesn't fall far from the tree, my friend.

idiom: 二 の 足 を 踏む
jp_contexts: 離婚の費用を考えると　いつも 二の足を踏んできたが フリックとの浮気のお陰で 彼女への支払い金額が半分になる ||| ずば抜けた技術で→ 医学界が二の足を踏む術法を 展開させ→ 救えない命を救ってきたのも 事実である」
english_translations: The cost of divorce always deterred me but her infidelity with Fricke cut the payout she'd receive in half. ||| It's also true that with their outstanding skills, they developed surgical procedures the medical world shied away from, and saved lives that otherwise would have been lost.

idiom: 人聞き が 悪い
jp_contexts: - "ハッキング"は人聞きが悪いです ||| 人聞きが悪い
english_translations: - "Hacked" is such an ugly word. ||| I wouldn't call it that.

idiom: 今 は これ まで
jp_contexts: でも今は　これまでの 経験の後では ||| 今はこれまで以上に重要よ
english_translations: But now, after everything we've been through... ||| And now it's more important than ever.

jp_contexts: 奴には家族がある 好むと好まざるに拘わらず 結果が付いて回るんだ ||| 気に留めるべきは 君が何かを犯したと 誰かが考えた場合 その情報は今後一生君に付いて回る
english_translations: Cantor has a family and a future and there are consequences for what he did or didn't do. ||| So it's important to note that if someone has a perception of you having done a thing, it will now follow you for the rest of your life.

idiom: 仲 を 取り持つ
jp_contexts: 誰がアンドリア人とテラライト人の 仲を取り持ったと思ってるのか ||| でも誰が俺とソビエト政権の 仲を取り持ってくれるんだ？
english_translations: Who does he think got the Andorians and Tellarites talking? ||| Who'll heal the breach between us and the Soviets now?

idiom: 似る て も 似る つく ない
jp_contexts: ほんと、アイドルの流河とは、似ても似つかないや ||| 似ても似つかないね
english_translations: You're right. He doesn't even look anything like him. ||| She's a different person altogether.

jp_contexts: 体を張ってくれた ||| あいつは仲間のために 体を張る男だ
english_translations: She saved my life, you know? ||| That man in there takes bullets for the people he cares about.

idiom: 何 が 何 で も,手 に 入れる
jp_contexts: 何が何でも手に入れてやりたい ||| 何が何でもゴンドールが 手に入れるのだ
english_translations: I will stop at nothing to get it for him. ||| We cannot let that happen. This thing must come to Gondor.

idiom: 何 は さておく
jp_contexts: 何はさておき ||| "何はさておき 駆けつけます"
english_translations: Above all else, ||| I'll drop everything. On my way.

idiom: 何 食う ぬ 顔
jp_contexts: 何食わぬ顔をしているが 良くなってはいないよ ||| 君の決断を批判する者を 対処しなければならない いつも何食わぬ顔で 始まる
english_translations: He's putting on a brave face but he's not doing well. ||| You have to deal with all those people constantly second-guessing your decisions, and it always starts out so innocently, doesn't it?

jp_contexts: 私も爺と同じ考えだ、長い期間、 兵を挙げる勇気を持てないだろう ||| カラマンオール・イブラーヒムが 兵を挙げたようです
english_translations: I think my mentor is right. He won't be able to dare anything for a very long time. ||| Karamanoglu started the campaign.

idiom: 切る て も 切れる ない
jp_contexts: この2つは切っても 切れないもの ||| 地球的な表現に「切っても切れない縁」とある
english_translations: Survival and sacrifice... they go hand in hand. ||| There's an Earth expression, "We're stuck with each other".

jp_contexts: お前が切羽詰まってる時に 一日に6マイルは走ってるし ||| 切羽詰まってる
english_translations: Look, I'm running six miles a day, I'm sleeping eight hours. ||| I'm dead in the water here.

jp_contexts: 寝返っては居ない 安心材料を必要としてる 力を落としてる ||| 一休みしろ　海軍の仲間達が 俺達のために抵抗力を落としてくれる
english_translations: He's still with us, but he needs to feel a sense of control, power. ||| Take a breather. Our pals in the Navy are going to soften them up for us.

jp_contexts: 口が過ぎるぜ ||| ようは　彼女を愛している だが　彼女はいつも口が過ぎる
english_translations: You talk too much. ||| I eventually loved her, but every time she got out of line,

idiom: 口車 に 乗せる
jp_contexts: 親しげな話の口車に乗せて 小僧をたぶらかす ||| 結局は口車に乗せられた 児童サービスについて
english_translations: With fawning flattery I must win the trust of the foolish, obstinate boy. ||| I sweet-talked this from a guy in child services.

idiom: 合わす 顔 が ない
jp_contexts: 大間違いだった 合わす顔がなかったんだ ||| 2度と合わす顔がない
english_translations: It's the biggest mistake I ever made. I just... I couldn't face you after that. ||| I can never show my face again.

jp_contexts: ジャーナリストとして 名を上げようとするかぎり ||| こんな事になるなんて思わなかったわ 私はいつも自分の名を 上げることに終始してたから 今回も自分が何とかしなきゃって
english_translations: "just so long as you can make a name for yourself "as an investigatory journalist, ||| It's something I never thought would happen to me because I've been so busy making a name for myself, and now I'm this close to making captain.

jp_contexts: 聞いたぞ！ 我が息子の一人が ペルシャの勇者に名を連ねたそうだな ||| おまけに投資先も 探しとる 新規事業の出資者に 名を連ねたいと
english_translations: I'm told that another of my sons has joined the rank of great Persian Warrior. ||| He has some venture capital that's burning a hole in his pocket... he says he might be willing to invest some start-up cash in a fleet of limos.

jp_contexts: 当然だ　命の綱だからな ||| このバッグを隠せ 俺達の命の綱だからな
english_translations: - Don't forget to pick up the water ration. - I'll do that. I'll die if I don't get water. ||| Hide this bag, it's our life insurance.

jp_contexts: 私は部下の命を 預かっている ||| 命を預かった
english_translations: I'm responsible for these men's lives. ||| We own your lives.

idiom: 喉 から 手 が 出る
jp_contexts: 政府は　喉から手が出るほど あのリストが欲しいんだろ ||| 喉から手が出るほど 哀れだね
english_translations: Your government must be salivating over that list. ||| Need one, desperately. It's quite sad, really.

idiom: 四 の 五 の 言う
jp_contexts: （山里） "四の五の言ってんじゃねえ"と "好きだったら好きでね お互い動きなさいよ"と ||| 四の五の言わずに働け
english_translations: She basically told them both to make a move if they like each other. ||| Why don't you shut the fuck up and get back to work, okay?

jp_contexts: 地獄に仏だ ||| 地獄に仏とは　このことだ
english_translations: There is a God. ||| Talk about a Good Samaritan.

idiom: 多く れる 少なく れる
jp_contexts: 多かれ少なかれ ||| 多かれ少なかれな
english_translations: - More or less. ||| Some just hide them better than others.

idiom: 夢 から 覚める た よう
jp_contexts: 夢から覚めたように 素晴らしい展望が開けると聞いているが ||| 悪夢から覚めたようだわ 信じられない
english_translations: I'm told it gives the feeling of great perspective, like waking from a dream. ||| Like I just woke up from a nhtmare. It was unbelievable, Ethan.

jp_contexts: その夢が覚めなかったら？ ||| 夢が覚めた
english_translations: What if you were unable to wake from that dream? ||| Good feeling's gone.

idiom: 夢 を みる,目 を 覚ます
jp_contexts: 亡くなる二ヶ月ほど前に 母は僕の夢を見た 目を覚ますとここに来て ||| 女王は 夢を見ます 少女が窓に座っています 女王が目を覚ますと 私は そこにいます
english_translations: A couple months before she died, she had this dream about me, and she... woke up, she came out here and she just started painting this as fast as she could. ||| The Queen will dream, that a little girl is sitting on her window sill.

jp_contexts: 膵臓では第一人者の 鳥井教授が執刀しますので→ 大船に乗ったつもりで いてください。 ||| 大丈夫 大船に乗ったつもりでいろ
english_translations: Professor Torii, who's considered a pancreatic expert, is your primary surgeon so rest easy and leave it to him. ||| It's all right, male. Relax to the max. Take a chill pill.

jp_contexts: それができて ぼくは天狗になった ||| 当然だと思うよ｡ それで 天狗になるわけでもなく｡ 性格もいいし アイデアも 豊富だし｡
english_translations: And then, when I finally got there, it wasn't me anymore. ||| And you're not stuck up about it, you have a good personality, and tons of good ideas, you work really hard.

idiom: 太鼓 判 を 押す
jp_contexts: 先月衛生指導員が来て 太鼓判を押して帰った ||| わが社も彼に 太鼓判を押すよ
english_translations: Look, we had the county health inspector here last month, and he gave us perfect scores. ||| And the way I feel, my company will underwrite him anytime.

jp_contexts: 司祭の前で契りを結び ||| - それは血で兄弟の契りを結んだんだ
english_translations: We say our vows in front of the high septon. ||| It was a Blood Pact! Like brothers!

jp_contexts: 俺らは宇宙を飛んでる ||| 宇宙を飛ぶのは 非常に危険だ
english_translations: I can feel it, we're falling through Space, you and me. ||| Makes flying through space very dangerous.

idiom: 射程 距離 に 入る
jp_contexts: "射程距離に入った" ||| 後５分で 山が射程距離に入ります
english_translations: I need help! He appears to be held at gunpoint but... ||| Saddle Ridge will be in weapons range in five minutes.

jp_contexts: あなたの尻を叩くため？ ||| どうする？ 俺の尻を叩く気か？
english_translations: Give you a swift kick in the butt if you need it? ||| What are you gonna do?

jp_contexts: "私の尻を押してくれ"と言ったんだ ||| "私の尻を押してくれ"って どういう意味ですか？
english_translations: He said, 'Pull back, my ass. We just got here. " ||| What does that mean, "Pull back, my ass"?

jp_contexts: 奴は気付いてなかった 尻尾を出すのを待ってるんだ ||| 終に尻尾を出したな
english_translations: Clearly, he has no idea. ||| So you're finally revealing your foxtail.

jp_contexts: 今や 幕が開いたのだ 過去は序章にすぎぬのだ ||| その時、どうでも良い 別の芝居の幕が開いた
english_translations: Now that we're in this time, what's past is prologue. ||| At that moment, the curtain rose on a parenthetical, domestic drama...

jp_contexts: そこで中野渡さんに引導を渡して ||| ロルカが引導を渡されるのを見たい
english_translations: and he'll sit in the chairman's seat. Is that it? ||| Hector lorca being sent away for life.

jp_contexts: 君がした中で　当を得た陳述は これが初めてだ ||| いや　当を得てるでしょ
english_translations: That's the first correct statement you've made. ||| No, that was a bull's eye.

idiom: 往生 際 が 悪い
jp_contexts: ねぇ　ハロルド 男の人ってどうしてこんなに 往生際が悪いのかしら? ||| 往生際が悪いわね
english_translations: Really, Harold, why do men always seek to delay the inevitable? ||| Too bad.

jp_contexts: 最高のオモチャを見つけて 久しぶりに心が躍りました ||| ♪ 心が躍るの
english_translations: I had found the perfect plaything. My heart danced with joy for the first time in a long time. ||| There 'll be magic There 'll be fun

jp_contexts: 家族とは互いに心を配るということだ ||| ウィルに心を配って
english_translations: And family means we take care of each other. ||| Take care of Will.

jp_contexts: お言葉ですが、私たちのコレクションです 私が心血を注いで 10年以上かけて集めたんです その労力を思えば... ||| 世界を正そうと 心血を注いでるじゃない
english_translations: No, you know what I think I'm actually entitled to say Our collection, considering the time that I've put in over 10 years curating that. ||| I've watched you. Working with the Fringe Division, you've done everything in your power to heal the damage.

idiom: 急う て は 事 を 仕損じる
jp_contexts: 急いては事を仕損じる ||| 急いては 事を仕損じるぞ
english_translations: Haste makes waste. ||| And you can't just rush into danger, either.

jp_contexts: お前達二人は 随分息が合ってるんだな？ ||| いい コンビじゃないか 息が合ってる
english_translations: You realize you two are finishing each other's sentences, right? ||| You know, for being new partners, you guys are pretty good together.

jp_contexts: 息を呑むような女性との出会いは? ||| 破壊は息を呑んだよ
english_translations: Or saw a woman who literally took your breath away? ||| Destruction was breathtaking.

jp_contexts: 社会が生き残り 繁栄する唯一の方法は 各々が正しい所属場所を 得ることいあるのです ||| 別の場所を得るのに 争う必要はないはず
english_translations: And the only way it can survive and thrive... is for each of you to claim your rightful place. ||| I said we didn't have to fight for another place.

jp_contexts: 助手が付くの 信じられる？ ||| あなたの家に買い手が付きそうなんです お若い夫婦らしいんですけど
english_translations: I'll have my own assistant. Can you believe that? ||| The most darling young couple just made an offer on your house.

idiom: 手 が 付ける られる ない
jp_contexts: だが　彼が３６人目を殺した頃までに 僕の中毒は　手が付けられなくなって ||| 君の想像以上に 奴には 手が付けられない面がある
english_translations: By the time he had claimed his 36th life, however, my addiction was out of control. ||| He's a greater danger to himself than you know.

jp_contexts: - 手が焼けるな ||| 思ったより手が焼けるな
english_translations: -This is so stupid. ||| Our job just got harder.

idiom: 手 に する,手段 を 選ぶ ない
jp_contexts: 欲しいものを手にするのに 手段を選ばない ||| 一族はカギを全て手にするまで 手段を選ばない だから君だ
english_translations: And I know you don't care who you hurt to get what you want. ||| And the families, they'll stop at nothing until they get their hands on those keys.

jp_contexts: グリーヴァスの手に掛かって 何回も惨敗してから、 共和国のアウター・リムでの足場が 危うくなってる ||| 私の手に掛かるとこうなる...
english_translations: After suffering a series of disastrous defeats at the hands of General Grievous, the Republic's foothold in the Outer Rim is in jeopardy. ||| My version is this.

idiom: 手 も 足 も 出る ない
jp_contexts: 手も足も出なかった ||| 誰も手も足も出ない
english_translations: I must admit we were out of skill. ||| There's nothing anyone can do about it.

jp_contexts: そして 手を伸ばした ||| 手を伸ばす以外に何をする？
english_translations: And I have. ||| There's only one way to find out.

jp_contexts: 両手を着け！ ||| 床に手を着け
english_translations: I said "hands on the ground"! ||| On the ground!

jp_contexts: 死ぬまで手を緩めない！ ||| 理論的には　検察官が わざと捜査の手を緩めることは可能だ 特に　状況証拠しかない事件はな
english_translations: He won't rest until you're dead! ||| Well, theoretically, a prosecutor could throw an investigation, especially one with circumstantial evidence.

jp_contexts: マックパパが手取り足取りで 教えてやるぜ ||| 俺がメンクを見つけられるよう 手取り足取り手がかりを教えてくれた
english_translations: All those girls are going to need some hands on help from the Mac Daddy. ||| He spoon-fed me the clues so I could find Menck.

jp_contexts: 1人の 手癖が悪かった ||| 手癖が悪いから 脅かしただけ
english_translations: What if one of them was light-fingered? ||| I just wanted to scare her because I caught her stealing.

jp_contexts: 女房が言うには、 毎日指折り数えているんだとさ 私の癌が再発する日を ||| 指折り数えていたんです
english_translations: She told me that she was counting the days until my cancer came back. ||| I counted down the days, sir!

idiom: 揃い も 揃う て
jp_contexts: 揃いも揃って ||| 揃いも揃って 何の用ですか？
english_translations: God almighty, I can't believe who ||| Okay guys...

jp_contexts: "女性下着というと" "敷居が高いイメージが ありますが" ||| なるほど でも少し敷居が高いかな 今直ぐは
english_translations: "Women's lingerie may give the impression of being expensive... ||| Yeah, well, that's kind of a tough sell right now.

idiom: 明ける て も 暮れる て も
jp_contexts: 警察と兵士 明けても暮れても人々に悲しみを与える ||| 明けても暮れても、生きねばならないこと、 そのように成らなければ ならないことを
english_translations: Cops and soldiers giving people grief day in, day out. ||| What he has to live with day in and day out, what that's got to be like.

jp_contexts: ここに長くはいられない 俺が時を稼ぐ ||| - 我々がその時を稼ぐ
english_translations: I can't give you long, but I can give you a head start. ||| -We can give him that.

idiom: 最期 を 遂げる
jp_contexts: スタニス・バラシオンは 良い最期を遂げなかったな？ ||| どんな最期を遂げようと 非常に特別な兵士だった
english_translations: It didn't end well for Stannis Baratheon, did it? ||| It doesn't matter how he ended, he was once something real special. Nonsense!

jp_contexts: わかったよ　この件は相当に 根が深いんだ ||| 悲しいけど　家族の確執は根が深いの
english_translations: Okay, this is deep, deep background. ||| It's very sad, but family feuds run deep.

jp_contexts: 兄貴はおまえらとは桁が違う... ||| - 桁が違う
english_translations: Lawrence is better than all you lot... ||| I'll meet you on the other side.

idiom: 棚上げ に する
jp_contexts: "しかし君と私には約束があったし" "君は終了を棚上げにしたからね" ||| モローは、彼のプロジェクトを棚上げに された為、レーンに復讐を望んでいる。
english_translations: But you and I had a bargain, and, uh, you held up your end. ||| Morrow wants revenge on Lane for mothballing his project.

idiom: 棚卸し を する
jp_contexts: 彼女が棚卸しをする ||| 殺人のあった夜　彼は棚卸しをしていたわ
english_translations: She should inventory what we have. ||| He was doing inventory the night of the murder.

jp_contexts: 死の商人だ 汚い仕事の為に 傭兵とB. O. ||| それは私の役割が死の商人としての 情報将校であることだ
english_translations: He's a merchant of death using mercenaries and B.O.W.s to do his dirty work. ||| It's my job to be the merchant of death as an intelligence officer.

jp_contexts: 私はただ気が緩んでいるだけだった ||| つい気が緩んで
english_translations: I just wasn't paying attention. ||| I'm not very focused tonight.

idiom: 気 に する,気 に なる
jp_contexts: 彼が死んだことは　気にしてないけど 殺されたことは　気になってるね ||| （ｱﾙﾏﾝ）別に もし本当に １週間とか経って気になったら 俺のこと気にしないで ドンドン バンバン...
english_translations: And you don't care that he's dead, but you do care that he was murdered. ||| If you're still interested in her after a week, don't worry about me.

jp_contexts: 離婚してから ヤツは物に気を回さなくなった 何か夢中になるものを 探してたように見えます ||| 気を回さないで　あなたに... 話が...
english_translations: Ever since his divorce, he didn't really care much about stuff. ||| I just came by to... talk.

jp_contexts: 全然　気合が入ってない ||| 鳥井教授　今日は 一段と気合が入ってますよ　ええ。
english_translations: There's absolutely no commitment. ||| Professor Torii is certainly fired up today.

jp_contexts: パン工房は ほんの氷山の一角ね ||| 歴史教科書から氷山の一角にしか学べない 自分の手で直接体験した方がよい
english_translations: The bakery's just the tip of the iceberg. ||| Archive texts can only teach you a part of the picture, my young Padawan. You'll learn a lot more through some hands-on experience.

jp_contexts: 決を採ろう ||| この場で決を採ろう
english_translations: We should vote. ||| On behalf of custodial services,

idiom: 決まり が 悪い
jp_contexts: 決まりが悪いわ。 ||| - ちょっと 決まりが悪いな
english_translations: He'd be embarrassed. ||| - Yeah, but it'd be pretty awkward.

jp_contexts: 私の頭に油を注いでくださる 私の杯は 溢れています ||| 主なる神の霊が わたしに臨んだ 主がわたしに油を注いで
english_translations: "You anoint my head with oil. My cup overflows. ||| The spirit of the Lord... is upon me, because he has anointed me... to preach good news to the poor.

jp_contexts: "泣きを見る" 君は言ってくれた ||| この件が蒸し返して 泣きを見なければいいんだが
english_translations: " It will end in tears. " You've warned me. ||| As long as this doesn't come back and bite us in the ass.

idiom: 浮き彫り に する
jp_contexts: だが彼は市の裏の部分 残忍さ暴力を浮き彫りにさせる ||| だが彼は市の裏の部分 残忍さ暴力を浮き彫りにさせる
english_translations: What that man does is carry out a dark reckoning for his city. It is a brutal, violent vision of justice, one we do not share. ||| What that man does is carry out a dark reckoning for his city. It is a brutal, violent vision of justice, one we do not share.

jp_contexts: 彼女の甘い香水が 俺の涙を誘う ||| ただ、私の歌はよく子供の涙を誘うがね
english_translations: Her perfume a sweet promise that brings tears to my eyes. ||| Yeah. On the other hand, my singing would often drive my children to tears.

jp_contexts: 渡りに船さ ||| 向こうにとっても 今回の提案は渡りに船だ
english_translations: Janitors go anywhere, everywhere, nobody pays any attention to them. ||| This proposal is a godsend to them as well.

jp_contexts: チキンはちゃんと火を通して ||| ゆっくり火を通す
english_translations: Make sure those chickens are cleaned properly. ||| -It's all about slow roasting.

jp_contexts: 俺は 5歳か、そこらかな、小さい町で、ワイルドバーグって、 ブラックフォレストにあったんだが、 ちょうど爆撃されて灰燼に帰したんだ、知ってるか？ ||| ダミーコ一味が すべて灰燼に帰すまで―
english_translations: I was five years old, or something, in a little town, Wildberg, in the Black Forest, and it was just bombed to ashes, you know? ||| Not 'til D'Amico and his whole damn operation are burnt to ashes.

idiom: 無駄口 を 叩く
jp_contexts: 新米の君たちへの忠告だ よく観察して 無駄口を叩くな ||| じゃ、無駄口を叩くな
english_translations: Now, a few words of advice as newbies on the job... eyes open, mouths shut. ||| Then don't waste time talking about it.

jp_contexts: これらの一つに焦点を絞りましょう ||| 焦点を絞りましょう
english_translations: I want to focus on just one of them. ||| Let's narrow the window of incident.

idiom: 煮え湯 を 飲ます れる
jp_contexts: 煮え湯を飲まされた ||| 銀行さんには 今まで どんだけ煮え湯を飲まされたか
english_translations: But to be betrayed by him... ||| I don't know how many times I've been burned by banks.

jp_contexts: 誰に熱を上げようと 構わんが... ||| 熱を上げた最近の 女がすることよ
english_translations: I wouldn't give a shit about your pathetic schoolgirl crush. ||| It's what us modern girls do when we have a crush.

jp_contexts: もっと熱を入れて ||| プレイに熱を入れろ！
english_translations: Come on, give me some heat... ||| Play with some energy now!

idiom: 熱い なる,胸 が 熱い なる
jp_contexts: プライスレスのライフワークです」 って　このコメント→ 実に素晴らしくて 胸が熱くなりました！ ||| Who'd have ever thought that this could be? 胸が熱くなるの
english_translations: To me, surgery is priceless life work." That comment was so very touching, I was fraught with emotion! ||| Who'd have ever thought that this could be

jp_contexts: 判った 物は試しだ ||| 物は試しと言うだろ
english_translations: Okay. ||| -All right. It was worth a try at least.

idiom: 猫 の 手 も 借りる たい
jp_contexts: 私たちは悪人になる為に参加してない 猫の手も借りたいくらいよ ||| 猫の手も借りたい、行くぞ
english_translations: We didn't join up to be in a gang. We did it so we could help people. ||| We need all the help we can get.

jp_contexts: 俺を玩具にして ||| 憶えてるさ 人を玩具にしやがって
english_translations: You're fucked up, you know that? ||| I know he remembers me! He's just messing with my head!

jp_contexts: 劣った男が立っているのを 前にして 「神は人間を平等に創造した」 だなんて 信じられるわけがない ||| 驚かすつもりはないが 君の後ろに 変な男が立ってる
english_translations: impermeable to reason, with cold, pallid slime in their veins instead of hot, red blood! ||| Um, I don't want to alarm you right now, but there's a fucking creepy dude standing right behind you.

idiom: 疑わしい は 罰せる ぬ
jp_contexts: 疑わしきは罰せずにね ||| "疑わしきは罰せず" だよ
english_translations: I gave you the benefit of the doubt over and over. ||| Hey, innocent until proven guilty, Jess.

jp_contexts: ほら　あの目がいい ||| お前の目がいいな
english_translations: Aw! Aw! Look at his eyes. ||| Yeah, buddy, look at your eyes.

jp_contexts: 彼らは目が利く ||| 我々は尊い金鉱夫だったんだ 闇の中でも目が利くのでね
english_translations: Well, they know a winner when they see one. ||| We were noble gold miners because we could see the light in the darkness.

jp_contexts: - 目が眩む 何も見えない ||| 本物の職人の技で 目が眩むわよ
english_translations: - I can't see. I'm blind. - Me too. ||| You'll be blinded by the sheer craftsmanship.

jp_contexts: わしの価値以上に─ 態度が目に余って 辞めるべきなら... ||| 目に余るほどの虚偽 これまでに見た事がない
english_translations: If I should cease to be useful, if my behaviors are outweighing my value, well... ||| A sorrier pack of deck wallopers I don't think I've ever seen.

jp_contexts: 私、私の目を欺くか？ ||| 俺の目を欺くことは出来ないぞ お前が化けても
english_translations: Do my eyes deceive me? ||| You can't bluff my eyes with your disguise

jp_contexts: 僕の目を盗んでは 古い地図に見入ってる ||| 君のママがその指を見て 手を洗いなさいって言うけど それでもママの目を盗んで その指舐めたりしてさ
english_translations: He spends hours and hours poring over old maps when he thinks I'm not looking. ||| And your mom probably told you to wash your hands, but I bet you'd just lick it off when she wasn't looking.

idiom: 目くじ ら を 立てる
jp_contexts: 私はスターラボが地域・社会のために、何が出来るか考えていた。 多分、もう人々はDr. ウェルズに対して それほど目くじらを立てていないだろう。 ||| - なんで、そんなに目くじらを立てる
english_translations: I thought if Star Labs could do something nice for the community, maybe people wouldn't be so angry at Doctor Wells anymore. ||| Do you understand that?

jp_contexts: そうさ... 教皇の話は 真に迫る ||| そして　完全な被害者だ 私　真に迫っていたわよね？
english_translations: Yeah, well, the Pope tells it like it really is. ||| I was so believable today, wasn't I?

jp_contexts: ２人だと知恵が回る ||| 犯罪者の誰もが　知恵が回るわけじゃない
english_translations: When working, it gets us nothing! ||| Not everyone's a criminal mastermind.

idiom: 知恵 を 借りる
jp_contexts: みんなが問題を 解決して欲しくて... あなたの知恵を借りに来るって 誇らしい気分でしょうね 何かトラブルを起こすんじゃないかと 思われてるよりも ||| 戦争に勝利した今 先人の知恵を借りる時だ
english_translations: It must be nice to have everyone always looking to you for answers to their problems instead of waiting for you to cause a problem. ||| Now that the war is won, we should all find time for wisdom.

jp_contexts: 兄さんも父さんも 知恵を絞ったけど―― ||| 知恵を絞るんだな
english_translations: No! Steve and Dad wracked their brains, - but they said it's impossible. ||| I have faith in your resourcefulness.

jp_contexts: 彼が近くに来るといつも 君の態度が少し硬くなる ||| 指が硬くなってる
english_translations: Your posture stiffens subtly whenever he gets close. I'm pretty sure it doesn't. ||| From here the tension passes on to your fingers.

idiom: 祝杯 を 上げる
jp_contexts: 奴を捕らえたら祝杯を上げよう ||| 祝杯を上げよう
english_translations: There'll be plenty of time for celebrating after we get Nazir. ||| I want to make a toast.

idiom: 笑い が 止まる ない
jp_contexts: - 笑いが止まらなかったよ ||| 笑いが止まらないって 経験ある？
english_translations: He kept making me laugh. ||| Have you ever had that feeling when you can't stop smiling?

idiom: 笑い 事 だ は ない
jp_contexts: パレスチナの問題は 笑い事ではない ||| 今のところ、しかし笑い事ではないの cuz我々は我々は彼を忘れてしまった。
english_translations: We do not consider the issue of Israel and Palestine a laughing matter. ||| It's not so funny now, though cuz we forgot where we put him.

jp_contexts: お前はラニスター軍の誰よりも筋がいい ||| お前は筋がいい
english_translations: You have better instincts than any officer in the Lannister army. ||| You have good instincts.

jp_contexts: 筋金入りの人達がいるから ||| 君の勇気は筋金入りだ
english_translations: There's some hardcore haters out there. ||| Your courage is legendary.

idiom: 終わる よい ば すべて よし
jp_contexts: まぁ　終わりよければ　すべてよし　だろ？ ||| 「終わりよければ　すべてよし」でしょ？
english_translations: Hey, all's well that ends well, though, right? ||| All's well that ends well, right?

jp_contexts: (記者)いやー｡ 絵になりますね｡ さすが チョコレート王子｡ ||| 絵になる場面だぜ ベイビー " 神様 いる？
english_translations: - Yes. Wow, it's as pretty as a picture. As expected of the prince of chocolate. ||| There's the money shot, baby.

jp_contexts: 老婆心ながら言わせてもらう ||| 見たところ 育ちが良くて あこがれたんでしょうけど 老婆心で言うと
english_translations: Let me give you a little advice, Eileen. ||| Look, you seem like a nice girl, and I'm sure joining a carnival looks like a lot of fun, but let me just tell you right now, you do not want to be here.

jp_contexts: お前が言った事で 俺の耳に残ったのは お前が死ぬと言うことだけだ ||| 耳に残る曲だな
english_translations: Yeah, you see, the only thing you've said that went into my ear was that you die. ||| I think the tune is rather catchy.

jp_contexts: こいつは 肝が据わってんだよ （馬場園）そうなんですよ ||| お前は肝が据わってる
english_translations: She gets what's going on. ||| You're a badass. You're not scared of shit.

jp_contexts: 判事は　どっちに肩入れすると思う？ ||| 何で そこまで 羽根専務に肩入れするんだ？
english_translations: Guess we'll find out in the morning. ||| Why is he going that far to back up Director Hane?

jp_contexts: - 胸が躍るね ||| レイモンド・タスクは... 胸が躍る妙案です
english_translations: - Interesting. ||| I think Raymond Tusk is an exciting, bold idea.

jp_contexts: どれ程胸が高鳴ってるか あなたが持って来たもの関して ||| そりゃいい　胸が高鳴るな！
english_translations: I can't tell you how excited I am about what you've brought to us. ||| Holy shit! That would be so uplifting.

jp_contexts: 思い出を胸に刻み 我々の友を讃えよう セドリックは思いやりに溢れ ||| 皆がその言葉を胸に刻んだ
english_translations: You remember that and we'll celebrate a boy who was kind and honest and brave and true, right to the very end. ||| Exactly what these people needed to hear.

jp_contexts: 母さんが 最も胸を打たれるだろう ||| 私は胸を打たれた　このバカとは 永遠に親友だと思った 私は やっとの思いで 感情を抑えた
english_translations: Your mother would have been most impressed. ||| I felt like embracing him as family... but then I controlled my emotions

jp_contexts: 山の向こうの息子について語るとき 胸を痛めた ||| 他の人間だったら 私達は来ることに胸を痛めて いないだろう
english_translations: His heart hurt when he spoke about a boy beyond the Great Mountains. ||| If it were anyone else, we wouldn't have troubled ourselves to come.

jp_contexts: 奴等は 胸糞が悪い ||| 分かっていることはドブネズミを見ると、 胸糞が悪くなるということだけです。
english_translations: They are fucking disgusting. ||| All you know is you find them repulsive.

jp_contexts: 動脈を取ってください。 ||| その30分後に、 あなたはニックの動脈を取ることになる
english_translations: You must've nicked an artery. ||| 30 minutes after that, you will nick his left anterior descending artery.

idiom: 脚光 を 浴びる
jp_contexts: ヘイゼルとリチャードは ２人にふさわしい脚光を浴びるのよ ||| 脚光を浴びるのが嫌らしい
english_translations: Hazel and Richard are gonna get the attention they deserve. ||| Why? I think she's afraid of being in the limelight.

jp_contexts: 腰を抜かすわ ||| 水の上まで歩けたら、奴らも腰を抜かすだろうな。
english_translations: You'd run from here in terror. ||| If we can walk on the water, they wouldn't dare shoot at us.

jp_contexts: でも腹を抱えて笑ったよ ||| その頃 俺様は... . はるか遠くの土地で 腹を抱えて大笑い
english_translations: Yes, but it was hilarious. We laughed like drains. ||| Meantime, Roland Turner is a thousand miles away, laughing his ass off.

idiom: 臆 病風 に 吹く れる
jp_contexts: 臆病風に吹かれたか！ ||| 今日戦わなかった為に、敵は 我が臆病風に吹かれたと思うかもしれません
english_translations: If it's a fight you want, you've met your match! ||| They may think we are discouraged because we're not fighting today.

idiom: 花 を 持つ せる
jp_contexts: 最後の曲はアレックスに 花を持たせよう ||| - 彼女に花を持たせて
english_translations: All right, all right. We let Alex shine a little bit on that last one. ||| - Let her have this.

jp_contexts: 惨めな俺の人生に花を添えられる ||| 君のライトセイバーが コレクションに花を添える
english_translations: In my brief, miserable life, there's the truth in it. ||| Your lightsabres will make a fine addition to my collection.

jp_contexts: 出入り不能にしている 茶番劇だな ||| これは茶番だわ　茶番！
english_translations: No radio or satellite transmissions. Nothing but trust. ||| This is a travesty. A travesty!

jp_contexts: 積荷を下ろすんだ ||| 積み荷を下ろして 中へ運ぶぞ
english_translations: Take everything off the wagon. ||| Okay, boys, let's get this haul unloaded and inside.

idiom: 薄い 気味 悪い
jp_contexts: 薄気味悪いほど ||| まったく薄気味悪いんです
english_translations: Well, they do bear an uncanny resemblance to the ears in the photograph. ||| - I don't know, man, he's been acting really weird lately.

jp_contexts: これが藪から棒に聞こえるのは知ってるけど 僕は今売り出し中の身だ ||| 藪から棒のオファーで
english_translations: I know this may sound farfetched, but I'm on the market now. ||| I can't believe you gave up your mop for this suit.

jp_contexts: 「血が騒ぐとき、心が痛むとき」 ||| 血が騒ぐよ
english_translations: ＃When the blood creeps, and the nerves prick,＃ ||| Gets blood pumping.

idiom: 血 は 水 より も 濃い
jp_contexts: 正確に言うと 血は水よりも濃くないだろ？ ||| 血は水よりも濃い
english_translations: Hasn't exactly been thicker than water, has it? ||| And blood is so much thicker than water.

idiom: 裏 を 返す ば
jp_contexts: 裏を返せば もし侵攻を続ければ デュバクは間違いなくデバイスを悪用するでしょう ||| 裏を返せば 失敗は許されないということだ
english_translations: On the other hand, if you authorize the invasion, dubaku will undoubtedly engage the cip device. ||| it means failure is not an option.

jp_contexts: ローラには裏表がなくて 誰に対しても同じ態度なの ||| 自由だから ローラには裏表がなくて 誰に対しても同じ態度なの ローラには裏表がなくて 誰に対しても同じ態度なの
english_translations: She is just a bird flying. ||| She doesn't have an attitude repertoire, she doesn't have anything.

jp_contexts: 汚い利益の２０００万ドルを 寄付したからと言って 襟を正した事にはならん ||| 襟を正さないと
english_translations: But even giving away $20 million of her company's ill gotten profits hasn't humbled Ms. Sherman much. ||| Yeah, actually, this is really, really nice.

idiom: 言う こと なし
jp_contexts: 一緒にやれたら　言うことなしだ ||| 言うことなしよ
english_translations: And if you do it together, it's fantastic. ||| It just couldn't have gone any better.

idiom: 言葉 が すぎる
jp_contexts: 言葉が過ぎるぞ ||| 言葉が過ぎる
english_translations: You're going too far! ||| You do not even think something like that.

jp_contexts: 詰まる所 これは仕事さ ||| 詰まる所 ジョンは 君をとても愛してるんだ この世の何よりも 君を失くして バラバラになっている
english_translations: And that at the end of the day, it's a job as most jobs are. ||| (SIGHS) Look, John loves you very much, more than anything in the world, and he's falling to fucking pieces without you.

jp_contexts: - 調べがついたところじゃ 家族を失って　彼はひどく荒み ||| 奴が自分じゃ買えない物を全部買うために 君から金を借りたことは　２分で調べがついた
english_translations: - Well,based on we could find, he was so devastated losing his family, ||| Well, it took us all of two minutes to find out he borrowed money from you, to buy all that stuff he really couldn't afford.

idiom: 趣向 を 凝らす
jp_contexts: 今までにない 趣向を凝らしている ||| 僕は趣向を凝らしてるんだ。
english_translations: It is a spectacle unlike most have ever witnessed. ||| I'm trying different things.

jp_contexts: ? ) 足が出て当然だ ||| 足が出ない
english_translations: No wonder he has issues. ||| But my feet wouldn't move.

jp_contexts: 身に余るご紹介を　どうも ||| 身に余る光栄です 違う。
english_translations: My thanks, Mr. McCabe, you are too kind. ||| We don't deserve this honor.

jp_contexts: （吉森） 岩崎先生が身を削って 作りあげたものは お前たちそのものだ ！ ||| 〈身を削ってる〉
english_translations: The thing that Iwazaki created at his own expense... Is YOU people! ||| [Seth] ...for better or worse.

jp_contexts: これは議論じゃあない まるでグリルで身を焼かれるようだ ||| お前自身を焼き尽くすのだ
english_translations: No, this isn't a discussion, it's a grilling. ||| It's gonna burn you out.

jp_contexts: 大変だな・・ 男社会で身を立てて行くのは ||| しかし　あんたが消えた後も 俺は舞台にいて 演劇で身を立てて 情熱を燃やし 複雑な感情と闘う それが演劇ってもんだ
english_translations: Amazing... what one has to do to get ahead in a man's world. ||| But long after you're gone, I'll be on that stage... earning my living, baring my soul, wrestling with complex emotions, 'cause that's what we do.

idiom: 返す 言葉 が ない
jp_contexts: 返す言葉がないね ||| そう言われたら 返す言葉がないわ そういうことさ
english_translations: Well, what can I say to that? ||| - Then there's nothing I can say.

jp_contexts: これは途轍もない大きさです ここ、カリフォルニアで 東海岸でも感じられるでしょう ||| ミュージカルへの投資には危険が伴う だけどヒットすれば 見返りは途轍もなく大きい
english_translations: It will be so big that even though it's happening here in California you will feel it on the East Coast. ||| Investing in a musical can be risky, but when a show hits, there's literally no limit to the return.

idiom: 運 を 天 に 任せる
jp_contexts: 運を天に任せるなんて したくないの... ||| 隠し口座 見つけたとしても 全部 国税に持ってかれんで やるだけのことは やりました こうなったら後は 運を天に任せるしかありません
english_translations: I DON'T LIKE TO LEAVE MUCH TO CHANCE... ||| the Taxation Bureau's gonna snatch everything away. we'll have to leave the rest to fate.

idiom: 郷 に 入る て は 郷 に 従える
jp_contexts: 郷に入っては郷に従えだ ||| 『郷に入っては郷に従え』よ！
english_translations: I prefer to work with people who know the area. ||| do as the Romans do!

jp_contexts: 大金が得られる ||| もし、こんな事をしてお金が 得られると思ってるんだったら とんでもない考え違いだわ
english_translations: Access billions. ||| If you think you'll take this money, terribly wrong.

jp_contexts: 鉄のカーテンの向こう側と 同じような ||| 鉄のカーテンの 内部を受け持つ 衛星４号と呼ばれる セクションにいた
english_translations: THINKS SOMEONE DRESS BEHIND THE IRON CURTAIN. ||| He was also a planner in the section called Satellites 4, which operates behind the Iron Curtain.

jp_contexts: あなたが暗殺者へ鉄槌を下すのを手伝えば エリアの正義を勝ち取ることを手伝う ||| 僕は　悪魔のようなサイコパスに 正義の鉄槌を下したんだ
english_translations: You help me serve justice to the king's assassins and I will help you serve justice to Elia's. ||| I gave an evil psychopath justice.

jp_contexts: 今この瞬間がいいんだ ||| バリでの2週間がいい！
english_translations: Best to take the moment present ||| I want two weeks in Bali!

jp_contexts: 「終身刑になるのが関の山だ」 ||| - オレみたいな男は... せいぜい成功者の下で 働くのが関の山なんだ 皆から愛されている 分かるだろ
english_translations: You get a life sentence for it. ||| - Guys like me... work their whole lives to be in something that's successful, that people like.

idiom: 陰 で 糸 を 引く,糸 を 引く
jp_contexts: 彼が誰が陰で糸を引いたか 知ってるか確認してくれ ||| 誰かが陰で糸を引いてるなら
english_translations: Make sure he knows who pulled the strings. ||| If someone's pulling their strings,

jp_contexts: 陰口を叩く者共はお前のおかげで助かった ||| 俺の陰口を叩いてくれてありがとう
english_translations: You defend these men who insult you behind your back. ||| Thanks for talking about me behind my back.

jp_contexts: 彼はただ、ええと、頭が固い。 ||| なぜお前はそう頭が固いんだ
english_translations: He's just, uh, not enlightened. ||| Must you always be so small-minded?

idiom: 頭 に 血 が 上る,血 が 上る

idiom: 顔 向け できる ない

idiom: 首 の 皮一 枚

english_translations: Your absolute unwillingness to accept anything less than everything. ||| He was an admirable craftsman who refused to take my advice no matter how much I tried. he wouldn't have had to commit suicide.

jp_contexts: 魂が抜けてる！ ||| 魂が抜けたようになった
